0.title: 300% growth in enrolment for Executive MBA program: SP Jain Global
0.article_body: The SP Jain Executive MBA is a global program which aims to transform managers into powerful leaders of tomorrow. The flexible 18-month program is taught by international faculty, has a diverse student body with 16 years of average work experience, includes opportunities to network via newly-introduced global immersion weeks in Singapore and Dubai, and results in an Australian degree.

1.title: Foreign agents in Twitter were flagged only by an outside agency: Whistleblower
1.article_body: Revealing that Twitter had a Chinese agent working on its payroll, whistleblower Peiter Zatko remarked that "foreign agents" working in the company would be flagged "only by an outside agency", subsequently leading them to find the person. During a hearing at the US Senate, Zatko said once Twitter learnt of that person, "it was extremely difficult to track the people".

2.title: Queen's last flight becomes the most tracked flight in history with over 5 million views
2.article_body: Over 5 million people viewed Queen Elizabeth's final flight on Tuesday, as the journey carrying the late monarch's body from Edinburgh to London became the most tracked flight in history. Flight tracking website Flightradar24 said a total of 4.79 million people watched the flight live online, while a further quarter of million people watched the journey on its YouTube channel.

3.title: Australia launch their jersey for T20 World Cup 2022, share pics
3.article_body: Australia have launched their jersey for T20 World Cup 2022. Australia will wear an Indigenous-themed kit at this year's T20 World Cup. The jersey features black sleeves and a green and gold gradient on the trunk of the playing top. It also features the Walkabout Wickets artwork. The kit has been designed by Aunty Fiona Clarke and Courtney Hagen.

4.title: Bayern beat Barca, Liverpool secure win over Ajax in Champions League
4.article_body: Bayern Munich extended their winning streak over Barcelona with a 2-0 Champions League Group C victory. This is Bayern's fifth straight win against Barcelona in recent years. Meanwhile, Liverpool registered their first win in the tournament after a 2-1 win over Ajax. Tottenham, however, lost their match against Sporting Lisbon, who are now at the top of Group D.

5.title: Hinduism teaches 'om shanti' but BJP is creating 'ashanti': Rahul
5.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said BJP is spreading "ashanti" in the country when the words first taught in Hinduism are "om shanti". "Please explain to me how a party, that calls itself a representative of the Hindus...creating 'ashanti' in the whole country? Wherever they are going they are destroying harmony…attacking people…dividing people and abusing them," Gandhi added.

6.title: Sensex falls 700 points, Nifty at 17,900 in opening trade
6.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Wednesday amid weak global cues. The Sensex fell 700 points to open at 59,867, while the Nifty lost 150 points to open at 17,900. Tech Mahindra, TCS, Wipro and Infosys were among the major losers. Nifty Smallcap 100 and Nifty Midcap 100 also slipped over 1%.

7.title: India reports 5,108 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, active cases at 45,749
7.article_body: India has reported 5,108 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 4,369 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India now stand at 45,749, while the death toll has risen to 5,28,216, according to the latest data. The daily positivity rate stood at 1.44%.

8.title: Amit Mishra trolls Shahid Afridi over his retirement advice for Virat Kohli
8.article_body: Veteran cricketer Amit Mishra trolled ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi over his retirement advice for Virat Kohli. Afridi stated that Kohli should retire on a high and not when he is dropped. "Dear Afridi...some people retire only once so please spare Virat Kohli from all this," Mishra wrote. Notably, Afridi is known for having announced retirement several times in his career.

9.title: Accident victim taken to hospital on JCB machine as ambulance gets late in MP
9.article_body: A video showing an accident victim being taken to hospital on a JCB machine in Madhya Pradesh's Katni has surfaced on social media. The decision to carry the man on the JCB machine was taken after the ambulance could not reach the spot on time. The owner of the JCB machine said auto rickshaw drivers refused to help the victim.

10.title: Difficult to compete with BJP the way Cong is functioning: Ex-Cong leader
10.article_body: Former Assam Congress General Secretary Kamrul Islam Choudhury on Tuesday said the way Congress is functioning these days, it is difficult to compete with BJP or other parties. "It's sad that no Congress leader from Delhi is coming to do ground study…I request them to unite state Congress first and then do 'Bharat jodo'," he added.

11.title: GHMC collects 80,000 MT of idol debris in Hyd after Ganpati Visarjan
11.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is carrying out the work to clear the debris of idols and other puja materials from the water bodies. As many as 10,000 sanitation workers worked in three shifts to expedite the collection of debris during the festival and 80,202 metric tonnes (MT) of debris were collected from water bodies in last few days.

12.title: Scolded by monitor, 14-yr-old boy hangs self at Mumbai shelter home
12.article_body: A 14-year-old boy died by suicide at the Don Bosco Shelter Home at Mumbai's Wadala on Monday after he was allegedly scolded by a monitor for not cleaning up the place properly. The boy, a Class 9 student, was found hanging in the bathroom. The victim's mother works as a cleaning lady and lives on the footpath.

13.title: 4 persons booked for beating stray dog to death in Lonavla
13.article_body: Four persons have been booked for allegedly beating a stray dog to death in Lonavla. According to a woman who runs a pet shop, the accused were hitting three stray dogs after which one went silent. While two dogs were seriously injured, they took away the body of the third and dumped it at an unknown location.

14.title: IPS officer who probed Ishrat Jahan encounter dismissed, HC stays order till Sept 19
14.article_body: Satish Chandra Verma, an IPS officer who had assisted CBI in its investigation into the Ishrat Jahan encounter case in Gujarat, was dismissed from the service on August 30. Delhi High Court, while hearing Verma's plea, has stayed the dismissal order till September 19. Verma was charged with "interacting with media" when he was a chief vigilance officer in Shillong.

15.title: 2 Pune policemen booked for abetment to suicide of 50-year-old man
15.article_body: Two officers of Pune City Police were among three persons booked for allegedly abetting suicide of a 50-year-old man. The victim, Rajendra Raut, was found hanging at his house on Monday. He was said to be facing harassment over a defaulted loan taken by his friend, for which he was the guarantor. Raut's daughter named two officers in an FIR.

16.title: Mandhana smashes 79*(53) to help India register 8-wicket win over England
16.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana scored an unbeaten 79-run innings off 53 balls to help her side register an eight-wicket win over England in the second T20I. India chased down England's 143-run target with 20 balls to spare to level the three-match series 1-1. The third and final match of the T20I series will be played on Thursday night.

17.title: Traffic curbs imposed in Bengaluru's Frazer Town today
17.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police have put traffic restrictions in Bengaluru's Frazer Town area today (September 14)  in view of the work of laying an additional railway track to the existing railway track lane near Pottery Road and Clarence Junction. As per the advisory, the movement of all types of vehicles is restricted on the Railway bridge of Clarence Junction.

18.title: Queen Elizabeth's coffin arrives at Buckingham Palace in London, pic goes viral
18.article_body: The coffin of the late Queen Elizabeth has arrived at Buckingham Palace as tens of thousands of people lined the streets in heavy rain to mark its arrival in London. King Charles and members of the royal family received the coffin at the palace. Queen Elizabeth died at Balmoral Castle in the Scottish Highlands at the age of 96.

19.title: Sachin shares video of his special method to clean bat grip, criticised for wasting water
19.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar shared a video of himself on Instagram showing him cleaning bat grip using soap and tap water. Calling it his "special method", Sachin said nobody taught him the style and added it's his "gut feeling". However, fans pointed out running tap in the video and criticised him for wasting water. "Sir...what happened to save water," a fan wrote.

20.title: Mumbai to get 227 free healthcare centres under BMC: Maha CM Shinde
20.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday announced that 227 free healthcare centres will be set up across Mumbai under the 'Hindu Hriday Samrat Balasaheb Thackeray' dispensary from October 2. The centres will function under the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) and conduct 139 medical tests free of charge, officials said. Around 50 centres would be launched in the first phase.

21.title: My tweets are being suppressed: Musk as Twitter shareholders approve $44 bn buyout
21.article_body: Tagging Twitter and its CEO Parag Agrawal, the world's richest person Elon Musk on Tuesday tweeted, "My tweets are being suppressed!" and asked them to fix the issue. On Tuesday, Twitter shareholders also approved the $44 billion buyout deal proposed by Musk. The company has sued Musk for terminating the agreement, the trial for which begins on October 17.

22.title: Prince Harry responds after being banned from wearing military uniform at Queen vigil
22.article_body: After he was banned from wearing military uniform at Queen vigil, Prince Harry said that he will wear a morning suit throughout events honouring his grandmother. "His decade of military service is not determined by the uniform he wears and we respectfully ask that focus remain on the life and legacy of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II," Harry's spokesperson said.

23.title: Drunk auto driver assaults Mumbai traffic policeman over e-challans
23.article_body: An autorickshaw driver allegedly assaulted a traffic policeman on duty on Monday in Mumbai. According to police, he appeared to be drunk and has received more than 30 e-challans in the last two years. "[The driver] started screaming about unnecessary e-challans issued by traffic police and verbally abused me for fining drivers," said the traffic policeman.

24.title: 65-year-old woman found dead at home in Pune; cash, jewellery missing
24.article_body: A 65-year-old woman was found dead, with injuries inflicted by a sharp weapon, at her home in Pune's Warje area on Tuesday evening, police said. Some cash and jewellery from the house were missing, police added. "Injuries were inflicted on her neck and hand because of which she is suspected to have bled to her death," police further said.

25.title: Man dies as scooty collides with DTC bus in Delhi, driver arrested
25.article_body: A man, aged about 30-35 years, died after his scooty met with an accident with a Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus in the Punjabi Bagh area, police said. The accident happened on Tuesday evening and the victim died on the spot, police added. The 32-year-old bus driver was apprehended and the vehicle has been seized, DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said.

26.title: NBA team owner Sarver suspended for 1 year, fined $10 million for workplace misconduct
26.article_body: Robert Sarver, owner of NBA's Phoenix Suns and WNBA's Phoenix Mercury, has been suspended for one year and fined $10 million by NBA for workplace misconduct. The NBA said that its investigation found that Sarver at times showed "inequitable conduct toward female employees", including "sex-related comments" and "inappropriate comments on employees' appearances".

27.title: Qatar's WC test sees water running out, emergency personnel stranded
27.article_body: Qatar's new Lusail Stadium, which will host football World Cup matches in November, ran a near-capacity test which reportedly saw long lines and stands running out of water by halftime. The 80,000-seat stadium, which will also host the final, reportedly had security and medical staff finding stadium access difficult. Organisers say they gained "invaluable experience" ahead of the tournament.

28.title: 17 get life imprisonment in 28-year-old double-murder case
28.article_body: As many as 17 people were awarded life imprisonment by a court in UP's Hamirpur on Tuesday in a 28-year-old double-murder case. The case pertained to the murder of Jaswant and Motilal on March 15, 1994. Of the 25 people originally accused of killing the duo, five died during the course of the trial while three others are still absconding.

29.title: Mexican drug lord jailed for killing US agent granted house arrest
29.article_body: The co-founder of Mexico's Guadalajara drug cartel, Miguel Angel Felix Gallardo, has been granted house arrest by a district judge after three decades in jail, prosecutors said on Monday. Gallardo, who is now 76 years old, was imprisoned in 1989 for the murder of a US Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) agent. Felix Gallardo is reportedly in poor health.

30.title: Gangster Lakhbir Landa's aide arrested in Punjab, 103-g heroin seized
30.article_body: Anmoldeep Soni, aide of Canada-based gangster Lakhbir Singh Landa, has been arrested in Punjab's Kharar, police said on Tuesday. Police recovered 103-gram heroin from his possession. Police said he is a member of the Landa module which was instrumental in the delivery of militant hardware and narcotics. Landa had conspired in the terror attack at Punjab Police Intelligence office, Mohali.

31.title: Siraj takes 5-wicket haul for Warwickshire in county cricket debut
31.article_body: Pacer Mohammed Siraj took five wickets for 82 runs in 24 overs as he helped Warwickshire bowl out Somerset for 219 on his county cricket debut. Pakistan opener Imam Ul Haq, George Bartlett, James Rew, Lewis Gregory and Josh Davey were the batters that fell to the pacer. Siraj has not been selected in India's T20 World Cup squad.

32.title: PSG looking to extend Lionel Messi's contract by 2 more years: Report
32.article_body: Ligue 1 club PSG are reportedly looking to extend Lionel Messi's contract by two more years as his current agreement expires next year. A report says fresh talks are unlikely to happen until after the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Messi has scored four goals and has made seven assists in nine games this season.

33.title: Resolve issues delaying peace process: Govt to Nagaland lawmakers
33.article_body: The Centre asked the Nagaland lawmakers' panel, led by Chief Minister Neiphiu Rio, to resolve the remaining core issues delaying the Naga peace process. Union Home Minister Amit Shah met with 11 members of the panel, seeking a final solution before the state assembly polls due next year. Rio said they urged for an honourable and early solution.

34.title: Right to contest elections not a fundamental right: Supreme Court
34.article_body: Observing that the right to contest elections is neither a fundamental nor a common law right, the Supreme Court imposed a cost of ₹1 lakh on a litigant. The litigant was seeking to contest the Rajya Sabha polls without a proposer to propose his name. "It (right to contest polls) is a right conferred by a statute", the bench said.

35.title: Assam to demarcate Army firing range in Tamulpur: CM Sarma
35.article_body: The Assam government has decided to demarcate an Army firing range in Tamulpur district, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said. He added that this is being done to reduce incidents of injury or death and damage to property in the test firings. The government is looking into providing financial assistance to families previously affected by this.

36.title: Twitter shareholders approve Elon Musk's $44-billion bid to buy company
36.article_body: Twitter shareholders on Tuesday approved Elon Musk’s $44-billion bid to buy the social media platform. Twitter said that the measure passed based on a preliminary count, adding that it will provide a final vote count to shareholders at a later date. Musk in July announced that he was calling off his bid to buy the firm.

37.title: May miss Shami's pace at some stage of T20 WC: Ex-chief selector Prasad
37.article_body: Former BCCI chief selector MSK Prasad said the squad for the T20 World Cup 2022 seems balanced but may miss Mohammad Shami's pace at some stage. He added that post the tournament, players like Sanju Samson, Ravi Bishnoi and Ishan Kishan may get more chances. He also backed Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli for the top-three batting slots.

38.title: Ram Temple's 1-month-long grand opening to begin from Jan 14-15, 2024: Trust
38.article_body: The one-month-long grand opening of Ayodhya's Ram Mandir will begin from January 14-15, 2024, Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust General Secretary Champat Rai said. He added that the temple's construction would be completed by end of 2023. Construction of six other structures inside the Janmbhoomi complex would also be completed by December 2023, he added.

39.title: Missing Uttarakhand's Champawat SDM found in Shimla
39.article_body: Uttarakhand's Champawat SDM Anil Chanyal, who had gone missing on Monday, was found in Shimla on Tuesday. Champawat District Magistrate Narendra Bhandari spoke to the SDM over the phone and said he was likely to return soon. Notably, Chanyal was reported missing by a home guard in his security detail. According to PTI, Chanyal had been stressed for some time.

40.title: Priyanka cried after she was offered a negative role in 'Aitraaz': Suneel Darshan
40.article_body: Producer Suneel Darshan revealed that Priyanka Chopra had cried after she was offered a negative character in 'Aitraaz'. "She was so upset, she cried, she went home and she went to sleep," he added. "I said after you wake up come back to the office...I pressed on her...the importance of...doing the role," Suneel further said.

41.title: It's tricky but I want Suryakumar at number 3: Rohan Gavaskar
41.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Rohan Gavaskar has commented on the Indian T20I team's batting order for games in the upcoming ICC T20 World Cup in Australia. "Suryakumar Yadav at number three [is] a pleasing thought. But Virat...showed what a tremendous success he is as an opener. It means KL Rahul will have to make way...It's one of those tricky...situations," Rohan said.

42.title: Queen Elizabeth's lookalike to retire after 34 years 'out of respect' for monarch
42.article_body: The late Queen Elizabeth II's 89-year-old lookalike Mary Reynolds has said she will stop impersonating the British monarch "out of respect" for her after her death. Reynolds has played the Queen in films and on television. Her most notable portrayal of Queen Elizabeth was in the 1990 comedy film 'Bullseye!'. She has also featured in a 'Doctor Who' episode.

43.title: Saw evidence of my wife cheating on me, couldn't sleep anymore: Ex-Italy footballer Totti
43.article_body: Talking about separating from his wife Ilary Blasi in July this year, World Cup-winning former Italy footballer Francesco Totti said that he couldn't sleep after seeing evidence of Blasi cheating on him on her mobile phone. He added, "That led to depression. I couldn't sleep anymore. I pretended nothing was wrong, but I was no longer me...I was someone else."

44.title: Dulquer can be a terrific discovery for other half of country: Balki on Chup
44.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki opened up about casting Dulquer Salmaan in his upcoming thriller 'Chup'. He said, "I was lucky to have someone super talented, a superstar in one half of the country, who speaks Hindi as if it's his mother tongue and who can be a terrific discovery for...other half of...country." Dulquer predominantly works in Malayalam and Tamil language films.

45.title: Himachal CM lays foundation stone for projects worth ₹42 cr in Palampur
45.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Tuesday laid the foundation stone for 17 developmental projects worth ₹42 crore in Kangra district's Palampur. "Himachal Pradesh has...made immense progress in all spheres of development during these 75 years," Thakur said. The literacy rate at the formation of the state was 4.8%, whereas today, the literacy rate has crossed 83%, he added.

46.title: Former Kerala minister & Janata Dal leader NM Joseph dies aged 79
46.article_body: Former Kerala Forest Minister NM Joseph passed away on Tuesday at the age of 79, his family said. Joseph served as the state Forest Minister from 1987 to 1991 and also worked as a professor of economics at the St Thomas College in Pala. He also served as Janata Dal's national vice-president. Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan condoled his demise.

47.title: EC delists 86 'non-existent' unrecognised political parties
47.article_body: The Election Commission of India on Tuesday delisted 86 Registered Unrecognised Political Parties (RUPP) that were found to be non-existent. Further, it declared 253 RUPPs as 'inactive', noting that they've not contested a single election either to the state general Assembly or the Parliament election 2014 and 2019. The EC barred these parties from availing benefits of Elections Symbol Order.

48.title: Queen Elizabeth II's coffin was made over 3 decades ago: Report
48.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's coffin will lie in state in London for four days ahead of her funeral on September 19. The English oak coffin is said to be crafted at least 32 years ago, AFP reported. It's lined with lead in accordance with royal family customs. The lead lining assists the body to last longer after burial in a crypt.

49.title: Diego Costa joins PL club Wolves, video of announcement with real wolves goes viral
49.article_body: Former Chelsea and Atlético Madrid forward Diego Costa has joined Premier League club Wolverhampton Wanderers (Wolves), with the club releasing an announcement video of the footballer with real wolves. Talking about the viral video, the 33-year-old footballer said, "I was scared to death. Holding that chain I kept thinking, 'What if this wolf thinks about jumping on top of me?'"

50.title: How can you already decide he'll go for runs: Gavaskar to fan over Harshal's selection
50.article_body: During a question-answer session conducted by 'Sports Tak', a fan questioned Harshal Patel's selection in India's T20 World Cup squad, saying he would go for runs as he bowls slow. Sunil Gavaskar responded, "We will see that once the tournament starts. How can you already decide that he will go for runs? Let the match happen first."

51.title: She's showing off her growth in greatness: Roddick on world no. 1 Swiatek
51.article_body: Andy Roddick praised Iga Swiatek following her US Open win, saying the world number one is showing off her growth in greatness. "Conditions/balls she wasn't a massive fan of...not having had her best stuff coming into this Slam. Still problem solved," he added. Swiatek has won seven titles in 2022, the most by a woman since Serena Williams in 2014.

52.title: Kohli is great option as opener for India in T20Is: Rohan Gavaskar
52.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Rohan Gavaskar said that batter Virat Kohli is a "great option" as an opener for India in T20Is. "You look at his (Kohli) T20 numbers, they are outstanding. He averages about 55-57 and his strike rate is about 160," Rohan said. He added, "His last innings, again unbeaten innings of 122, tells you that he...relishes opening."

53.title: Prefer dynastic rule over current autocracy, dictatorship: Shiv Sena
53.article_body: The Shiv Sena, through its mouthpiece 'Saamana', said "a dynastic rule would seem preferable" to the "autocracy and dictatorship" in the country. They also praised the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and said the questions raised by Rahul Gandhi seem to "have shut BJP's mouth". It added that the 'yatra' will "repair the atmosphere of hatred" prevailing in the country.

54.title: Thackeray's supporters sprinkle cow urine after Maha CM's event; video surfaces
54.article_body: A video showing supporters of former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray sprinkling cow urine using lemon leaves at the venue of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's event in Aurangabad has surfaced on social media. Maharashtra Legislative Council Leader of Opposition Ambadas Danve, part of Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, earlier said cow urine was poured to purify the road after Shinde passed through it.

55.title: Ban breeding and keeping of dogs like Pitbulls: PETA to Centre
55.article_body: PETA has written to the Centre asking for a ban on the breeding, selling and keeping of dogs like Pitbulls, which are bred for fighting and racing. "For those (Pitbulls) that are already at home, they need to be registered and sterilised," said PETA. The group also said that such dogs are used for fighting, leading to physical mutilations.

56.title: Inflation not a 'red-letter priority' for FM Sitharaman: Chidambaram
56.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday criticised Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman over the rise of the inflation rate to 7% in August. Chidambaram said, "Only a few days ago, the Honourable FM said...inflation wasn't a 'red-lettered priority' for her." "If [Sitharaman] doesn't see 'red' even now, we can...conclude that she doesn't represent the average family in India," Chidambaram added.

57.title: CCI rejects complaints against PVR-INOX proposed deal
57.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) rejected a complaint against the proposed merger of PVR and INOX Leisure. The CCI said that apprehension of the likelihood of the anti-competitive practices cannot be subjected to inquiry. A complaint was filed by non-profit group CUTS stating that the proposed deal will have anti-competitive effects on the industry and demanded a detailed probe.

58.title: 'I can't bear this bloody thing,' says King Charles as he gets frustrated at leaky pen
58.article_body: A video shows King Charles getting frustrated at a leaky pen on Tuesday during a signing ceremony in Northern Ireland. "Oh god I hate this (pen)!" King Charles said, standing up and handing the pen to his wife and Queen Consort Camilla. "I can't bear this bloody thing...every stinking time," Charles stated as he walked away.

59.title: Ayushmann, Rakul's 'Doctor G' to release on Oct 14: Report
59.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana and Rakul Preet Singh-starrer 'Doctor G' is set to release on October 14, according to a report. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, the date will enable the film to get a clear run of 11 days until the release of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Ram Setu' and Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God'. 'Doctor G' also stars Shefali Shah.

60.title: Arshdeep messaged me he isn't bothered about trolls: Childhood coach Rai
60.article_body: Commenting on trolling and criticism faced by India pacer Arshdeep Singh after he dropped a catch against Pakistan in Asia Cup 2022, his childhood coach Jaswant Rai said, "He also sent me a message that he is not bothered." He added, "He was, in fact, upset because he conceded a boundary versus Pakistan. He was dejected because of that boundary."

61.title: Concerned about Russia aggravating Azerbaijan-Armenia conflict: US
61.article_body: The US is concerned that Russia could try to aggravate the situation arising out of the latest fighting between Azerbaijan and Armenia, U.S. State Secretary Antony Blinken said on Tuesday. He added that Washington is "always" apprehensive about Moscow exploiting such events to divert attention from the conflict in Ukraine. Armenia has reported losing 49 soldiers in the renewed fighting.

62.title: Who are the top 10 men's tennis players as latest rankings released?
62.article_body: US Open 2022 winner Carlos Alcaraz, aged 19, has become the youngest male tennis player to become world number one. US Open 2022 runner-up Casper Ruud has jumped to the second position, while Daniil Medvedev has slipped three spots to the fourth position. Rafael Nadal remains at the third position, while Novak Djokovic dropped one spot to be ranked 7th.

63.title: Not answerable to anybody: Nisha on 'extramarital affair' accusation
63.article_body: Actress Nisha Rawal has reacted after her estranged husband Karan Mehra accused her of having an extramarital affair with a man named Rohit Satia. She said that she's "not answerable" to anyone. "After...breakup, what I do in my personal life, it's none of his business and what he does in his personal life is none of my business," Nisha added.

64.title: 'Nabanna Cholo' has rattled the corrupt, power-drunk in WB: Pradhan
64.article_body: Speaking about BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march, Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Tuesday said the protest march has rattled the corrupt and power-drunk in West Bengal. The state has risen to reclaim its glory, he added. "West Bengal has risen against anarchy, corruption and murder of democracy. No amount of muscle-flexing and state-sponsored violence will mute people's voices," Pradhan said.

65.title: Shudras will be insulted till they remain Hindus: DMK's A Raja
65.article_body: DMK leader A Raja reportedly said that Shudras were 'insulted' and 'denied equality' in Manusmriti and it would continue to happen till they 'remain Hindus'. "You are the son of a prostitute...a Panchaman (Dalit)...an untouchable till you remain a Hindu," Raja allegedly said. He also reportedly asked if "there (is) any other country meting out such cruelty?"

66.title: PM Modi to unveil National Logistics Policy on Sept 17
66.article_body: The National Logistics Policy will be released by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on September 17, Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said on Tuesday. The policy is aimed at facilitating the seamless movement of goods across India, the minister added. The policy's introduction was announced by the central government during the presentation of the Union Budget 2020-21.

67.title: India issues statement as deadly border conflict erupts between Armenia & Azerbaijan
67.article_body: A deadly border conflict between Armenia and Azerbaijan erupted this week, killing around 50 Armenian soldiers and an undisclosed number of Azeris. India issued a statement on the conflict, saying, "We call upon the aggressor side to immediately cease hostilities." India added, "There can be no military solution to any conflict. We encourage both sides to pursue talks."

68.title: There was violent sex in 'Game of Thrones', it made me nervous: Emily
68.article_body: 'House of the Dragon' actress Emily Carey said that there is a lot of violent sex in 'Game of Thrones' and revealed it made her nervous. "I was like, 'Oh God, what am I gonna have to do in this show?'," she added. Emily stated that the showrunners Ryan Condal and Miguel Sapochnik made the entire cast feel secure.

69.title: Punjab govt to give monthly stipend to sportspersons
69.article_body: Punjab Sports Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer launched the Olympian Balbir Singh Senior Scholarship Scheme, which aims to give a monthly stipend to sportspersons who bag the first three positions in national competitions. The scheme provides a monthly stipend of ₹8,000 for one year to senior national medal winners while the junior national medal winners will get ₹6,000.

70.title: Assistant Police Commissioner attacked during BJP's rally in Kolkata
70.article_body: A video has surfaced online, purportedly showing an Assistant Commissioner of Police being attacked with sticks by a mob during BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march to the state Secretariat in Kolkata. Several people, including BJP supporters and police personnel, were reportedly injured in the incident. A police vehicle was set ablaze and a police kiosk was vandalised allegedly by BJP supporters.

71.title: Earth could become more habitable if Jupiter's orbit is shifted: Study
71.article_body: With a little shift in Jupiter's orbit, Earth could become more habitable, a study stated. If Jupiter's orbit is adjusted to become more eccentric, it will change the shape of Earth's orbit. Due to this, some parts of Earth that are currently sub-freezing and inhospitable would get closer to Sun and become warmer, making the planet more suitable for life.

72.title: 55-year-old woman dies after being swept away in UP's Saharanpur
72.article_body: A 55-year-old woman died after being swept away due to a sudden gush of water in the foothills of Shivalik in UP's Saharanpur. The victim was travelling with her three daughters and driver when they saw water coming toward them, forcing them to abandon their vehicle. Villagers helped the family out of the water but couldn't save the mother.

73.title: 'Fabulous Lives...' isn't staged or scripted: Neelam Kothari
73.article_body: Actress Neelam Kothari has said that the new season of 'Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives' isn't staged or scripted after some Twitter users alleged that the show seemed to be scripted. "What comes out of the four of us cannot be staged or fabricated. If that were the case, then all...of us would need an Oscar," Neelam stated.

74.title: Opening innings is where we could see best of Pant in T20 cricket: Jaffer
74.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant's batting position in T20 cricket, Wasim Jaffer said he thinks that opening the innings is where everyone can see the best of the Indian wicketkeeper-batter. "Provided Rohit is ok to bat at four," he added. Jaffer named KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant, Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav as his top five in India's T20I squad.

75.title: New investors don't trust current Maha govt: Aaditya Thackeray
75.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Aaditya Thackeray criticised the Maharashtra government over the Vedanta group choosing Gujarat to start a semiconductor unit. "We were working to bring this project to Pune...new investors do not trust the current government," said Thackeray, adding that he's "shocked". He said the Uddhav Thackeray government had "everything but documentation" done with Vedanta over the project.

76.title: 1 killed, 9 injured in firing by bike-borne men at multiple locations in Bihar
76.article_body: One person was killed and nine others were injured in firing by bike-borne men at multiple locations in Bihar's Begusarai on Tuesday, the Superintendent of Police said. Police are examining CCTV camera footage of the incident. Union Minister and Begusarai MP Giriraj Singh demanded that Bihar government give ex-gratia of at least ₹1 crore to the family of the deceased.

77.title: Was attacked by BJP MLA's goon in Guj: Congress MLA Jignesh Mevani
77.article_body: Congress MLA Jignesh Mevani was attacked by a goon of BJP MLA and former minister Pradipsinh Jadeja at a public meeting in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Monday, the Dalit leader's social media team said. Congress leader Hitendra Pithadiya said, "The attack [by Jadeja's man Labhu Desai] took place in the presence of police...[This] shows the law and order situation in Gujarat."

78.title: Eggs thrown on my car in Kodagu at BJP leaders' behest: Siddaramaiah
78.article_body: Karnataka Assembly's Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah on Tuesday said eggs were thrown on his car in Karnataka's Kodagu last month at the behest of some BJP leaders. Siddaramaiah said that black flags were also shown while he was on his way to meet farmers. "We reached this stage after doing all that (black flag protest)...This shouldn't have happened," he added.

79.title: Karnataka school buys bus by selling betel nuts grown on its land
79.article_body: A government school in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district purchased a bus with the revenue it earned from selling betel nuts grown on its land. The school had outsourced its 4.15 acres of land wherein villagers planted 628 saplings of areca nut. The 118-student strong school earned enough in two years to buy a 26-seater bus costing ₹5 lakh.

80.title: JSW Steel partners with German firm to cut carbon emission, to invest $1.3 bn
80.article_body: JSW Steel has signed an agreement with Germany-based engineering and technology company SMS group to explore solutions to cut down carbon emissions at its plants. JSW Steel will reportedly invest around $1.3 billion for the same. It targets to bring down GHG emissions by 42% to less than 1.95 tonnes of carbon dioxide per tonne of crude steel by 2030.

81.title: Passenger complains about not getting window seat, Ryanair's response goes viral
81.article_body: A passenger took to Twitter to complain to Ryanair about not getting a window seat despite having paid for it. The passenger shared picture showing she got the seat next to the emergency door. Ryanair responded to her complaint by encircling the small circular glass opening that the emergency door had. "@Ryanair is technically correct," a Twitter user jokingly commented.

82.title: I agree: Kejriwal on Shah's 'dream sellers won't win in Guj' comment
82.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday agreed with Home Minister Amit Shah's remark saying those who "sell dreams" will never be triumphant in Gujarat. "[Shah] said the absolute truth...That's why I don't believe in BJP since they only show dreams," Kejriwal said. People remain on BJP's side because they support those who believe in doing work, Shah had said.

83.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after England's series win vs SA?
83.article_body: Following their 2-1 series win against South Africa, England are placed seventh on the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 38.6% of points won. South Africa are second with 60% of points won. Defending champions New Zealand are lying eighth on the table with 25.93% of points won, while India are fourth with 52.08% of points won.

84.title: FBI notified Twitter of at least 1 Chinese agent working at the firm: Whistleblower
84.article_body: Former Twitter executive-turned-whistleblower Peiter Zatko has stated that Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) had notified Twitter of at least one Chinese agent working at the firm, Senator Chuck Grassley said. Zatko added that some Twitter employees were concerned that Chinese government would be able to collect data of some Twitter users. Zatko used to work as Twitter's head of security.

85.title: 'Adipurush' makers to launch film's teaser on Oct 3 in Ayodhya: Report
85.article_body: The makers of 'Adipurush' will launch the teaser of the film at a "grand on-ground event" in Ayodhya on October 3, according to a report. Directed by Om Raut, the film will feature Prabhas as Lord Ram, Saif Ali Khan as Ravan and Kriti Sanon as Sita. 'Adipurush' will release in theatres on January 12, 2023.

86.title: Woman's body found in washroom of Lucknow hotel
86.article_body: The body of a 26-year-old woman was found in the washroom of a hotel in Lucknow's Qaiserbagh area, police said on Tuesday. The identity of the deceased was established from her Aadhaar card. According to reports, one person has been taken into custody for interrogation. The woman had come to the hotel on Monday with a man, as per police.

87.title: Raj Kapoor was happy to see me in Indian attire when we met: Mandakini
87.article_body: Actress Mandakini revealed that actor Raj Kapoor was happy to see her in Indian attire when they first met. She further added, "He said, 'Had you worn jeans or a t-shirt then I wouldn't have liked it at all'. He said he wanted somebody homely." Mandakini went on feature in Raj's last directorial film 'Ram Teri Ganga Maili'.

88.title: I go for Roger: Müller on choosing between Federer and Nadal
88.article_body: When asked to choose between Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal, FC Bayern Munich forward Thomas Müller said, "I go for Roger." Federer, who hasn't played since his quarter-final loss at Wimbledon 2021, has won 20 Grand Slams so far. Nadal took his Grand Slam tally to 22 after winning the Australian Open and French Open this year.

89.title: Dream sellers won't win, BJP to retain power in Gujarat: Amit Shah
89.article_body: Amit Shah said that BJP will retain power in Gujarat and will sweep the polls with a two-thirds majority. In an apparent dig at the Aam Aadmi Party, Shah said, "People who sell dreams will never get electoral success in Gujarat. I know the people of Gujarat." Assembly polls in Gujarat are due in December.

90.title: Video of Secunderabad fire shows blaze started after e-bike caught fire
90.article_body: CCTV video of the massive fire that killed eight people in Secunderabad shows that the fire started at the electric bike showroom located in the basement of the building. The video shows smoke emanating from near an e-bike's wheel and slowly spreading around the vehicle. The vehicle can later be seen catching fire following a small explosion.

91.title: Karnataka govt to enforce Prohibition of Cow Slaughter Act
91.article_body: The Karnataka government is looking to train police sub-inspectors to prevent animal cruelty and enforce the Prohibition of Cow Slaughter Act. Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu B Chavan held a meeting with Karnataka Animal Welfare Board and was displeased that cattle traffickers and illegal slaughterhouse owners escaped punishment. Chavan was told that names in the charge sheet were being omitted.

92.title: Set up oncology dept in all medical colleges: Andhra CM to health dept
92.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy on Tuesday instructed the health department to set up an oncology department in all medical colleges. Speaking during a Health and Family Welfare department review meeting at Tadepalle, he said, "It will help us with more PG seats along with the resources to treat the patients at government facilities."

93.title: 4 men fight crocodile, pull villager out of its jaws in Gujarat
93.article_body: Four men reportedly fought a crocodile and pulled a man out of its jaws at Vishwamitra river in Gujarat's Vadodara on Sunday. The crocodile grabbed Narpat Rathwa's legs when he walked into the river in a drunken state. Four men fought the reptile and hit it with sticks. After a 25-minute-long tussle, the crocodile finally let go of Rathwa's legs.

94.title: NYAY scheme was the next evolution of the idea of MGNREGA: Rahul
94.article_body: During a meeting with MGNREGA workers, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the NYAY scheme was the "next evolution" of the idea of the MGNREGA scheme. "MGNREGA is a very good program but we also have to think of the next generation of MGNREGA...[as] now a large part of the population lives in urban areas," Rahul said.

95.title: BharatPe appoints RBI ex-Dy Guv Kanungo & Zomato Chairman Dutta to board
95.article_body: Financial services platform BharatPe has appointed former Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor BP Kanungo and Zomato Chairman Kaushik Dutta as independent directors to its board of directors. BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer said that the company plans to go public in the next 2-3 years. Last month, BharatPe appointed former finance head of SBI Cards, Nalin Negi, as CFO.

96.title: UK police officer who shot dead unarmed man suspended from duty
96.article_body: A police officer who shot dead a 24-year-old unarmed Black man in south London last week has been suspended from duty, the Metropolitan Police informed. A "significant impact on public confidence" was among the reasons why the officer was suspended, the police force added. Chris Kaba was fatally shot following a police chase by armed officers.

97.title: Govt sets up panel to suggest ways to scale up VC/PE investments
97.article_body: The government has set up an expert committee to suggest ways for scaling up venture capital and private equity (VC/PE) investments, a circular issued by Finance Ministry said. The panel will "comprehensively study the end-to-end frictions and potential accelerants from regulatory policy and taxation to facilitate ease of investing", it said. SEBI's former Chairman M Damodaran will head the panel.

98.title: It's a democracy, it's fine: Swara on Kangana's 'B-grade actress' remark
98.article_body: Swara Bhasker in an interview spoke about her Twitter feud with Kangana Ranaut, which happened in 2020. "Kangana Ji...called me and Taapsee (Pannu) B-grade actresses...I felt it was an invitation to talk," she said. Asked about her comments, Swara said, "It's fine. It's a democracy, people have...right to say what they want...My logic is...if you're talking then I'll also talk."

99.title: AP gets ₹40,361 cr-industrial investments between Jan-Jul: Report
99.article_body: Andhra Pradesh has topped the list of states in attracting industrial investments in the first seven months of 2022, a report by DPIIT stated. Of the total investment of ₹1,71,285 crore that the entire country received between January-July 2022, Andhra Pradesh got the investment of ₹40,361 crore. Reportedly, Andhra and Odisha combined have bagged 45% of the total investment.

100.title: Punjab AAP says BJP offering ₹25 cr to its MLAs to switch sides; BJP asks for proof
100.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party in Punjab on Tuesday alleged that BJP has contacted some seven to 10 of its MLAs in the past week, asking them to join the party and get ₹20-25 crore each. Punjab Minister Harpal Singh Cheema alleged that AAP MLAs are also being threatened. BJP has termed the allegation false and asked AAP to show proof.

101.title: Video shows bulldozer taking MP patient to hospital as ambulance doesn't arrive
101.article_body: Congress MLA Ravi Joshi has shared a video showing a bulldozer carrying a person, who he claims is a patient, in Madhya Pradesh's Katni. Joshi claimed the man, who reportedly sustained injuries in a road accident, was being taken to a hospital due to lack of an ambulance. The man had reportedly waited for an ambulance for over 30 minutes.

102.title: Man beats wife, makes her sit semi-naked in the Sun in Raj; video of assault emerges
102.article_body: A man employed as a private teacher in Rajasthan's Jodhpur was arrested after footage of him thrashing his wife in front of their two children surfaced online, officials said on Tuesday. The man allegedly made his wife sit semi-naked in the Sun and thrashed his daughter when she tried to stop the assault. Footage reportedly also showed his wife crying.

103.title: Bajaj Holdings announces interim dividend of ₹110 per equity share
103.article_body: Bajaj Holdings & Investment Ltd has said that its board has approved an interim dividend of ₹110 per equity share of the face value of ₹10 for the financial year ending March 31, 2023. "The record date for the purpose of determining the members eligible to receive the interim dividend has been fixed as Friday, September 23, 2022," it added.

104.title: Astronaut shares pic showing fish-eye lens long-exposure view of Earth from space
104.article_body: Astronaut Don Pettit took to Twitter to share a picture showing fish-eye lens long-exposure view of the Earth from the Cupola module of the International Space Station (ISS). He wrote, "Below, city lights flow as orange streaks, and faint star trails that show...Earth's rotation are visible in...lower left. #astrophotography can find exciting ways to combine both science and art!"

105.title: Already thinking of origins story on SRK's Brahmastra character: Ayan
105.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has said that he is thinking of an origins story for Shah Rukh Khan's character in the film 'Brahmastra'. Shah Rukh, who played a scientist, had a cameo in the film. "Before the fans were saying it, we were also saying that ourselves," Ayan stated. The first instalment of 'Brahmastra' featured Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

106.title: 2,800-kg maglev car that floats above highway tested in China, video surfaces
106.article_body: A car equipped with magnetic levitation (maglev) technology was recently successfully tested on a highway in China. The 2,800-kg vehicle 'floated' 35 millimetres above the road surface, powered by electromagnetic force and guided by pre-installed conducting rails. China had unveiled the first maglev train in Shanghai in 2004.

107.title: Need to find a way to play more Test cricket: Mark Boucher
107.article_body: South Africa's head coach Mark Boucher said that the "heads" of cricket "need to find a way" to play more Test cricket. "It's exciting, especially with the way the games are being played now," Boucher said. He added, "I'm a purist. I love test cricket to bits...To lose sight of test cricket and lose games is not great."

108.title: Saudi police arrests man seen with 'Umrah for Queen Elizabeth' banner
108.article_body: A Yemeni man was arrested by Saudi police on Monday after he posted online a video of him holding a banner in Mecca's Grand Mosque. The banner read, "Umrah for the soul of Queen Elizabeth II, we ask God to accept her in heaven and among the righteous." He was arrested for "violating regulations and instructions" of the holy site.

109.title: US inflation eases to 8.3% in August; falls for second straight month
109.article_body: The US' consumer price index (CPI) rose 8.3% in August 2022, data released by the US Bureau of Labor Statistics showed. It is down from 8.5% recorded in July and 9.1% reported in June, which was a 40-year high. Increases in the shelter, food and medical care indices were the largest contributors to the rise in US' CPI.

110.title: BSF apprehends B'deshi national with gold worth ₹17.5 lakh in Meghalaya
110.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Tuesday apprehended a Bangladeshi national on India-Bangladesh border of Meghalaya's West Jaintia Hills district with three gold biscuits weighing 348 grams, approximately worth ₹17.57 lakh. The 62-year-old Bangladeshi national was identified as Mohammad Hason Ali. The seized gold biscuits were handed over to the Customs office of Dawki, a BSF official said.

111.title: Uttarakhand to conduct survey of all madrasas in state: CM Dhami
111.article_body: The Uttarakhand government will conduct a survey of all madrasas in the state, Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami said. "Many types of things come up from time to time, so it is very important to conduct a proper survey of madrasas at once," Dhami said. Uttar Pradesh had earlier announced a similar survey of unrecognised madrasas.

112.title: Ultra-processed foods linked to higher risk of developing dementia: Study
112.article_body: People consuming high amounts of ultra-processed foods may be at higher risk of developing dementia than others, a study stated. Ultra-processed food like soft drinks, chips, ice cream, sausage and ketchup are low in protein and fibre, and high in sugar, fat and salt. They may contain food additives or molecules that have negative effects on thinking and memory skills.

113.title: I was lucky Djokovic couldn't play: Alcaraz on his 1st Grand Slam at US Open
113.article_body: Following his maiden Grand Slam win at US Open 2022, world number one Carlos Alcaraz said he was lucky that 21-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic couldn't participate in the last Grand Slam of the season. The unvaccinated Serbian was denied entry to the US owing to vaccination protocols. "I don't want to take credit away from myself," he added.

114.title: Indian-origin man jailed in Singapore for stealing 3 Coca-Cola cans
114.article_body: A 61-year-old Indian-origin man was sentenced to six weeks' jail for stealing three Coca-Cola cans worth around ₹170 in Singapore. The man committed the theft when he was walking past a minimart at a housing society. The store owner noticed that the fridge door was slightly open and got to know about his involvement through CCTV camera footage.

115.title: HC seeks report from Bengal Home Secretary over BJP's Nabanna march
115.article_body: The Calcutta High Court has sought a report from West Bengal Home Secretary over BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march to the state Secretariat in Kolkata, which turned violent on Tuesday. The report has to be submitted on September 19. The HC further directed police to not illegally detain any person and to ensure that there is no damage to public property.

116.title: 3 kids playing in J&K injured as shell explodes at encounter site
116.article_body: Three children were injured after an unexploded shell went off in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Tuesday, officials said. The leftover shell exploded at an encounter site at Heff Shirmal while the children were playing nearby. The children were rushed to a hospital. A local militant was killed in an encounter on Monday at Heff Shirmal.

117.title: Titles and credits are in Hindi now, it's a good move: Irshad Kamil
117.article_body: Speaking about the presence of Hindi in the film industry, lyricist Irshad Kamil has said that steps have been taken to improve the language's presence. "Now film titles and credits are in Hindi too, which is a good move," he stated. Irshad added directors can create situations where only Hindi is used for lyrics and dialogues to improve things further.

118.title: Any opportunity to captain Aus would be a privilege: Warner
118.article_body: After the Australian ODI skipper Aaron Finch recently retired from the format, Australian batter David Warner said that "any opportunity to captain would be a privilege". "I haven't had any conversations at all...But...there's a lot of water to go under the bridge, to have those conversations with Cricket Australia and my main focus is just actually playing cricket," Warner said.

119.title: Amazing performance: Djokovic on Alcaraz's 1st-ever Grand Slam win
119.article_body: Novak Djokovic took to Instagram Stories to congratulate 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz following his maiden Grand Slam win at US Open 2022 and wrote, "Amazing performance." "Congratulations also to Casper Ruud for the fantastic season he is having," he added. Alcaraz beat Ruud 6-4, 2-6, 7-6(7-1), 6-3 in the final. The Norwegian lost in his second straight Grand Slam final.

120.title: Apple rolls out watchOS 9 with Medications app, AFib History feature
120.article_body: Apple has started rolling out the latest watchOS 9 with an all-new Medications app and an AFib History feature. The new watchOS also includes four new faces - Lunar, Playtime, Metropolitan and Astronomy. The Workout app has also been updated to support a new Multisport workout type that automatically switches between any sequence of swimming, biking and running workouts.

121.title: Centre has tasked probe agencies with targeting Opposition: Raj CM
121.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Tuesday criticised the Centre and accused it of misusing its probe agencies. "The Centre has tasked the agencies like Income Tax Department, the CBI with targeting the Opposition," Gehlot said. "They didn't find one person in eight years in the BJP, which is considered to be a party of businessmen, entrepreneurs and money-lenders," Gehlot added.

122.title: Farmers protest against proposed IIT campus in Goa
122.article_body: Farmers staged a protest against the proposed Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) campus in Goa on Monday. A farmer claimed that the state government was acquiring the land for the campus without the consent of the farmers, who have been growing crops on it for generations. CM Pramod Sawant said, "The land...belongs to the government. Some people are...encroaching the land."

123.title: 20 people arrested for stealing 300 mobile phones in Andhra Pradesh
123.article_body: As many as 20 people were arrested in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor district on Tuesday for allegedly stealing 300 mobile phones worth ₹30 lakh from various places across the district. "Rewards were given to the people from the technical department who helped solve this case," Chittoor SP Y Rishanth Reddy said.

124.title: Arrests made in killing of Revolutionary Guards colonel, Iran says
124.article_body: Several people have been arrested in connection with the killing of a colonel of Iran's Revolutionary Guards that took place in May this year, a spokesman for the country's judiciary said on Tuesday. Hassan Sayad Khodai was shot dead by two assailants on a motorcycle in Tehran. Iran had blamed the killing on Israel and its Western allies.

125.title: There's more to it: Warner on captaincy ban not just being a result of sandpaper scandal
125.article_body: Australia opener David Warner has claimed that the lifetime captaincy ban imposed on him by Cricket Australia is not just a result of the 2018 sandpaper scandal. He stated that there was "more to it", including 2017’s dispute between players and CA over a new MOU. As per reports, Warner and Cricket Australia would discuss overturning his captaincy ban.

126.title: PDP's self-rule formula can resolve J&K issue: Mehbooba Mufti
126.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday said her party's self-rule formula has the potential to resolve the issue of Jammu and Kashmir. "Self-rule...can find a solution to the issue without changing the boundaries or compromising the integrity of both India and Pakistan," Mufti said. Criticising the BJP, she accused party of turning Jammu and Kashmir into a prison.

127.title: 35-yr-old man arrested for abducting, raping teenage girl in MP
127.article_body: A 35-year-old was arrested for allegedly abducting and raping a 16-year-old tribal girl for five days in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district, police said on Tuesday. "A 16-year-old girl...was abducted by Arun Tiwari on the night of September 3 from her home," ASP Vivek Lal said. The girl managed to escape from captivity on September 8 when the accused was away.

128.title: To be in same sentence as Arthur Ashe in anything is unbelievable: Tiafoe
128.article_body: World number 19 Frances Tiafoe, who became the first Black American man to reach the semi-final of US Open since Arthur Ashe in 1972, said, "To be in the same sentence as Arthur Ashe in anything is unbelievable." "And that's something no one can ever take from me so I'm gonna remember that forever," he added. Tiafoe lost in semi-final.

129.title: 'Don't touch my body, you're a lady,' BJP's Suvendu tells policewoman at Bengal rally
129.article_body: A video has shown BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari telling a policewoman to not 'touch his body' amid commotion during the party's 'Nabanna Cholo' march on Tuesday. "You are a lady, I am male," Adhikari told the police personnel who was trying to get him to board a police van. He was among several BJP leaders detained during the march.

130.title: Queen Elizabeth II's will to be sealed and locked in a safe for at least 90 years
130.article_body: The will of Queen Elizabeth II will be sealed and locked in a safe for at least 90 years. The practice of sealing wills of deceased royals dates back to 1910. By convention, after a senior royal dies, the executor of their will applies to the head of the London High Court's Family Division for the will to be sealed.

131.title: Firoz Nadiadwala to make 5D film on Mahabharat on budget of ₹700 cr: Report
131.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala is working on a film based on Mahabharat, according to reports. It'll reportedly be made on a budget of ₹700 crore and actors including Akshay Kumar, Ajay Devgn and Ranveer Singh are being considered to play pivotal roles in the film. "Mahabharat will be...first Indian film to be shot in 5D," a source was quoted as saying.

132.title: 'Maarrich' has challenged me as an actor on many levels: Tusshar
132.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor, speaking about his upcoming film 'Maarrich', has said that the film has challenged him as an actor on "many levels". "It's very different from the work that I have been associated with earlier, I hope the audiences like this new shade of mine," he added. Tusshar has produced the film which also features Naseeruddin Shah.

133.title: I don't think it's realistic to lead Aus in 3 formats: Pat Cummins
133.article_body: Australian Test skipper Pat Cummins said that he doesn't think it's "realistic" to lead the country in all three formats. "Especially as a fast bowler, I think you do need to find windows to rest...I am really happy with captaining the Test side," Cummins said. Notably, the last Australian ODI skipper, Aaron Finch, retired from the format on Sunday.

134.title: The core of Vikram Vedha's story is inspired by Vikram Betaal: Makers
134.article_body: Director duo Pushkar and Gayatri, speaking about 'Vikram Vedha', said, "The core of [the film's] story is inspired by the famous folklore of 'Vikram Betaal'." "We were fascinated with the dynamics shared by Vikram Betaal and so when we started writing the story of our film, we adapted that nostalgia into the characters of Vikram & Vedha," they added.

135.title: Ronaldo is the greatest of all time: Zidane on choice between Messi, Ronaldo
135.article_body: On being asked to pick between Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi, Zidane said, "Cristiano is the best. Messi is his rival and it's the rivalry everyone wants to see." He added, "But Ronaldo is phenomenal. There are no words to describe him. He's much better than me even though I had a great career. He's the greatest of all time."

136.title: Plastic may be making you obese: Scientists
136.article_body: Certain chemicals known as 'obesogens' present in several everyday items might be making you obese, scientists have warned. These chemicals disturb normal functioning of human metabolism and directly boost the production of fatty tissues associated with obesity. 'Obesogens' are found in regular items like plastic packaging, clothes, furniture, cosmetics, food additives, herbicides and pesticides.

137.title: Cong, Rahul involving children in political campaigns: NCPCR to EC
137.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has written to Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar seeking action against Congress and party leader Rahul Gandhi for allegedly "misusing children" as "political tools" under 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. NCPCR claimed Rahul, other party leaders and its children's wing 'Jawahar Bal Manch' were making them participate in political campaigns.

138.title: Shanaya to begin shooting for Bedhadak by end of 2022: Sanjay Kapoor
138.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor has said that his daughter Shanaya Kapoor will begin shooting for 'Bedhadak' by the end of 2022. 'Bedhadak', which will be produced by Dharma Productions, will be Shanaya's debut film in Bollywood. Earlier, there were reports that the film had been shelved. 'Bedhadak' will also feature Laksh Lalwani and Gurfateh Pirzada.

139.title: 'We’re aam aadmi, we travel on chartered plane': BJP on Kejriwal
139.article_body: BJP on Tuesday alleged that Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal used a chartered plane to travel to poll-bound Gujarat. BJP's Harish Khurana tweeted, "We are aam aadmi, we travel by chartered plane only". BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa said that Kejriwal's "drama" of projecting himself as a common man or eating with auto drivers is a "farce".

140.title: Pepperfry appoints 2 independent directors to its board
140.article_body: Pepperfry has appointed two independent directors to its board of directors, following which the board will comprise of three executive directors and four non-executive directors, the company said. The independent directors are Sanjay Baweja, OnMobile Global Limited Managing Director and CEO and Malini Parmar, Stonesup.in Co-founder. Pepperfry claims to have raised $240 million to date.

141.title: Ex-MP CM Kamal Nath's helicopter makes emergency landing due to rain
141.article_body: A helicopter carrying former Madhya Pradesh CM and senior Congress leader Kamal Nath made an emergency landing on a college ground in Sehore near Bhopal due to rainfall on Tuesday. He was accompanied by Congress' state unit chief JP Agarwal and MLA Jaivardhan Singh. They then proceeded to their destination by road.

142.title: Fire breaks out at Jubilee Hills building in Hyderabad, no casualty reported
142.article_body: A fire broke out at a commercial building, that houses 800 Jubilee pub, on Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills Road on Tuesday. No casualty was reported, an official said, adding the pub was being renovated and welding works inside the building sparked the fire. This comes a day after eight people were killed in a fire at an e-bike showroom in Secunderabad.

143.title: India to assume G20 Presidency in Dec, summit to be held in Sept 2023
143.article_body: India will assume the Presidency of G20 for one year, from December 1, 2022, to November 30, 2023, the MEA confirmed via a press release on Tuesday. After taking charge, India is expected to host over 200 G20 meetings across the country, the release stated. India will host the G20 summit in Delhi on September 9 and 10, 2023.

144.title: Chinese are laughing on Indian media reports quoting PM Modi's govt: Swamy
144.article_body: BJP member Subramanian Swamy said that the "Chinese are laughing away on Indian media reports" quoting PM Narendra Modi's government that "India and China have vacated to either side of LAC". "Truth [is that] China has withdrawn from Indian land and India has withdrawn from Indian land. Thus, China claims [that]...what is yours is also mine," Swamy tweeted.

145.title: UP BJP leader forges IAS officer's sign for ₹1.6 cr loan, arrested
145.article_body: According to police, a BJP leader named Ravi Pratap Singh was arrested in Uttar Pradesh on Monday for securing a loan of ₹1.62 crore by allegedly forging the signature of his nephew, who is an IAS officer. In 2020, IAS officer Abhay Singh had registered a cheating complaint against his maternal uncle. Ravi allegedly took loan from Urban Co-operative Bank.

146.title: Mumbai Police shares post on traffic safety with 'Brahmāstra' reference, Alia says 'Epic'
146.article_body: Mumbai Police shared a post to spread traffic awareness with a reference to 'Brahmāstra'. It did so by referencing the 'astras' (weapons) shown in the film to talk about traffic safety and wrote in the caption, "'Junoon' & 'Raftar' can put your 'Universe' at risk. Driving safe is the biggest 'Astra' forever." Sharing the post, actress Alia Bhatt wrote, "Epic."

147.title: Which 34 drugs have been added to essential medicines list?
147.article_body: As many as 34 drugs have been added to the National List of Essential Medicines (NLEM) 2022 which was announced on Tuesday. Four anti-cancer drugs- Bendamustine Hydrochloride, Irinotecan HCI Trihydrate, Lenalidomide and Leuprolide acetate- are among them. Anti-bacterial medicines like Meropenem, Cefuroxime, Phenoxymethyl Penicillin and Procaine Benzylpenicillin are now also essential medicines.

148.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
148.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD), in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. It is likely over Maharashtra and Gujarat till September 15. Goa may witness very heavy rainfall till September 16. It is also likely over Rajasthan on September 14 and 15 and over Uttar Pradesh from September 15 to 17.

149.title: RBI may hike interest rates by 50 bps as inflation rises: Analysts
149.article_body: RBI may increase interest rates by another 50 basis points in September, analysts said. This comes after data showed that the country's retail inflation rose to 7.0% in August from 6.71% in July. "[Another] month of above-target inflation clears...path for further monetary tightening at the next MPC (Monetary Policy Committee) meeting," said Rahul Bajoria, chief India economist at Barclays Bank.

150.title: NASA sets September 27 as next launch date for Artemis I
150.article_body: After two failed attempts, NASA said it is eyeing September 27 as the next launch date for Artemis I mission. The agency will conduct the cryogenic demonstration test no earlier than September 21 and is also reviewing a potential backup launch window option for October 2. The launch window on September 27 would open at 9.07 PM IST, NASA stated.

151.title: Video shows lightning striking high-rise in Mumbai's Borivali West
151.article_body: A video showing a lightning strike the top of a high-rise in Mumbai's Borivali West has surfaced online. An Instagram user shared the video with the caption, "So this just happened today right around tea time...It was distressing to witness this." The user later updated the caption and informed that no one was hurt because of the incident.

152.title: 5 men gang-rape woman after beating, tying up her boyfriend in Guj
152.article_body: Five men gang-raped a woman in front of her boyfriend at a field in Gujarat's Surat, police said. According to officers, the 27-year-old survivor was sitting with her boyfriend on the roadside when the men arrived and asked the couple to accompany them. When the man refused, they allegedly beat and tied him up before gang-raping the woman.

153.title: Dark Energy Camera captures 'Lobster Nebula' shining red
153.article_body: NOIRLab released an image of the star-forming 'Lobster Nebula' on September 12 captured by its Dark Energy Camera. About 8,000 light years away from our planet, the 'Lobster Nebula' houses the open cluster of unusually bright and massive young stars. While the image shows the nebula shining red, the areas surrounding the young stars show a slightly bluish glow.

154.title: EU energy ministers to meet on Sept 30 to approve emergency measures
154.article_body: Energy ministers of EU member nations will meet on September 30 in an attempt to approve bloc-wide temporary emergency measures aimed at bringing down rising gas and power prices. The proposals are expected to be unveiled by the European Commission this Wednesday. The proposals will go through deliberation by member countries before the final draft can be approved.

155.title: Dr BR Ambedkar had a major role in formation of Telangana: KTR
155.article_body: Telangana IT minister KT Rama Rao on Tuesday said that Dr BR Ambedkar had a major role to play in the formation of the state. Speaking in the state Legislative Assembly, KTR said, "The highest symbol of India is the Parliament." "We appeal to the Indian government to name the new Parliament building after Dr Ambedkar," KTR added.

156.title: BJP afraid of success of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Congress' Kamal Nath
156.article_body: Congress leader Kamal Nath on Tuesday said that BJP is afraid of the success of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. He also accused the BJP of trying to divert people's attention from Rahul Gandhi's success. Criticising the Madhya Pradesh government, Nath said, "The state was facing unemployment and farmers' issues but now it has turned into 'corruption capital of the country'."

157.title: Gurugram's Leela Hotel hoax bomb call traced to autistic person
157.article_body: The hoax bomb call that was received at Gurugram's Leela Ambience Hotel on Tuesday morning was traced to a 24-year-old person suffering from autism, who is currently undergoing treatment. The call was received at the hotel's reception desk at around 11 am and prompted a thorough investigation by the police, following which it was declared a hoax call.

158.title: Stranger Things-Deadpool crossover project is on the table, says Shawn Levy
158.article_body: Filmmaker Shawn Levy revealed that a crossover of 'Deadpool' and 'Stranger Things' is "on the table". "Ryan Reynolds and I were trying to figure out how in the world could we do a...crossover. We haven't cracked it yet...but it's on the table," he said. Shawn produced 'Stranger Things' and will be directing the upcoming third instalment in the 'Deadpool' franchise.

159.title: Chant 'Rajiv Gandhi amar rahe', 'Gehlot zindabad' or face jail: Raj CM's advisor
159.article_body: Babulal Nagar, advisor to Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot, reportedly threatened the crowd at an event in Dudu to chant only two slogans - 'Rajiv Gandhi amar rahe' and 'Ashok Gehlot zindabad'. He warned the attendees that if anyone was found raising any other slogan, the person will be arrested, and a case will be registered against him/her.

160.title: 4 held for destroying CCTV camera at Mangaluru's Someshwar beach
160.article_body: Four people have been arrested for allegedly destroying CCTV camera and the fencing put up at the Mangaluru's Someshwar beach, police said on Tuesday. The tipper lorry used by the accused has been seized, police added. The CCTV was installed on the instruction of district deputy commissioner to prevent illegal sand transportation near Someshwar temple and the beach, police said.

161.title: 'Bhabi Ji...' actress Shubhangi approached for 'Bigg Boss 16': Reports
161.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai!' actress Shubhangi Atre has reportedly been approached for 'Bigg Boss 16'. According to reports, Madirakshi Mundle from 'Siya Ke Ram' is also in talks to be part of the Salman Khan-hosted show. Reportedly, Shilpa Shetty Kundra's businessman-husband Raj Kundra has also been approached for the show. The upcoming season will reportedly premiere in October.

162.title: Congratulations of Nadal is always special: Alcaraz after winning US Open
162.article_body: Reacting to Rafael Nadal's congratulatory message following his maiden Grand Slam win at US Open 2022, fellow Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz said, "The congratulations of Rafael Nadal is always special." Earlier, Nadal tweeted, "Congratulations Alcaraz for your first Grand Slam and for the number 1 [spot]." The 19-year-old became the youngest world number one in men's tennis after winning US Open.

163.title: Cong leader upset over exclusion of Shami, Siraj from India's T20 WC squad
163.article_body: Congress leader Tauseef Alam expressed his disappointment with the exclusion of Mohammad Shami and Mohammed Siraj from India's recently announced T20 World Cup squad. He has alleged that the team selection process wasn't fair and has said that he won't watch cricket until there is a fair selection in the Indian team.

164.title: Kerala students escape unhurt as dogs chase them, video surfaces
164.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, stray dogs were seen chasing students in Kerala's Kannur, who managed to escape unhurt. Seconds into the video, two boys can be seen running towards the gate of a house and shut it before the dogs made their way into the compound. The boys were identified as Shahban and Mansoor.

165.title: 'Breathless' director Jean-Luc Godard passes away at 91
165.article_body: Veteran filmmaker Jean-Luc Godard passed away at the age of 91 on Tuesday. Godard, who directed 'Breathless' and 'Alphaville', is known for his work in the French cinemas during the 1960s. French newspaper Liberation reported the filmmaker's death. His 1960 film 'Breathless' featured Jean-Paul Belmondo and Daniel Boulanger.

166.title: Ghaziabad civic body engages 2 private agencies to dispose e-waste
166.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has engaged two private agencies to collect and dispose of electronic waste from households in 100 residential wards of the city. The enlisted agencies will pay according to predefined charges for old electronic items while collecting them, an official said. According to the rates, residents will get ₹2400 for their 1.5-tonne scrap air conditioner, he added.

167.title: Meghan hugs girl mourning Queen Elizabeth's death, video of exchange goes viral
167.article_body: A video has shown Meghan Markle hugging a girl who was among throngs of mourners waiting outside Windsor Castle after Queen Elizabeth's death. A now-viral clip posted on TikTok showed Meghan telling the girl, "Thank you for being here, it means so much to the family. We appreciate it." Several fans have praised Meghan for the gesture.

168.title: I'm choron ka sardar: Bihar minister as he accuses Agri Dept of theft
168.article_body: In a now-viral video, Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh said that there's no wing in the state Agriculture Department that doesn't steal. "As I am the in-charge of the department, I become choron ka sardar (leader of thieves)," the RJD leader added. He alleged that Bihar's seed corporation embezzled around ₹200 crore in the name of giving relief to farmers.

169.title: BJP-ruled MCD has given 3 garbage mountains to Delhi: AAP's Gopal Rai
169.article_body: BJP-ruled Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has given three garbage mountains to Delhi in last 15 years, Delhi Environment Minister and AAP leader Gopal Rai said on Tuesday. "BJP will either have to remove Delhi's garbage or itself from MCD," Rai said. AAP also announced the launch of its 'anti-waste campaign' across Delhi from September 14 onwards.

170.title: It’s rubbish: R Balki on claims that Bollywood is finished
170.article_body: Filmmaker R Balki said that the Hindi film industry is going through a phase and the claims that Bollywood is finished are "rubbish". He said the phase "won't last for too long". Giving an example of 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', Balki added, "As you are already seeing, people are storming the theatres. So, it'll change."

171.title: Dead fish found in B'luru's Haralur Lake for 2nd time in 2022
171.article_body: Hundreds of dead fish were found floating in Bengaluru's Haralur Lake on Tuesday, making it the second instance of fish kill in the lake since May this year. "Sewage is responsible for more than 55% of fish kills in Bengaluru," said Raghavendra B Pachhapur, programme manager with ActionAid Association, adding that the lake ecosystem has suffered setbacks time and again.

172.title: Fire at Iranian oilfield brought under control; sabotage alleged
172.article_body: A fire that is suspected to be the result of an act of sabotage at Iran's Shadegan oilfield was brought under control on Tuesday, an oil company's official told state media. The fire purportedly occurred at one of the active wells of the oilfield. "The damage is being evaluated but the field will return to production shortly," the official informed.

173.title: Entire team gave their best, we made it: SL skipper Shanaka on Asia Cup win
173.article_body: Praising Sri Lanka following their Asia Cup win, skipper Dasun Shanaka said, "Entire team gave it their best and we made it!" Sri Lanka defeated Pakistan by 23 runs in final to clinch their first title since 2014. They won five matches in a row after losing to Afghanistan in their first match. Overall, it was Sri Lanka's sixth title.

174.title: Ensure no person in Haryana is homeless: CM Khattar directs officials
174.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday directed state government officials to ensure that no person remains homeless in the state. At a meeting held to review the implementation of central schemes in the state, Khattar urged officials to make adequate arrangements to provide houses to all needy people. The CM also directed officers to expedite construction work of houses.

175.title: Survey of unaided madrasas is a targeted survey & is wrong: Owaisi
175.article_body: After the UP government announced its decision to conduct a survey of unrecognised madrasas in the state, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "It is a targeted survey against the Muslim community." "Doing survey of unaided madrasas is a targeted survey and is wrong," he said. "Survey of private schools, missionary schools, government schools and RSS schools should happen," he added.
