176.title: K'taka man fires at wife for refusing to go with him from her parents' home
176.article_body: A man was arrested in Karnataka's Belagavi for allegedly firing at his wife after she refused to go with him from her parents' home. The woman had left him three months ago over his alleged extra-marital affair. He begged her to return many times and had also threatened to kill her and commit suicide if she didn't return to him.

177.title: Priyanka Gandhi demands rollback of Allahabad university's fee hike
177.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi supported the student protest against Allahabad university's fee hike and called the BJP government’s move anti-youth. “The 400% fee hike is another anti-youth move of the government. Children from ordinary families of UP, Bihar come here to study. By increasing fees, the government will take away a major source of education from these youth,” said Priyanka.

178.title: India not defending Rupee, it can take care of itself: CEA Nageswaran
178.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said India isn't defending the Rupee and that the currency "can take care of itself". "I don't think Indian fundamentals are such that we need to defend the Rupee," Nageswaran added. "RBI is making sure that whatever direction the Rupee is moving in line with the market trends is just gradual," he said.

179.title: Zendaya hides face as Emmy host jokes she is 'too old' to date DiCaprio, video viral
179.article_body: A video shows actress Zendaya, who recently turned 26, hiding her face as Emmy host Kenan Thompson joked she's "too old" to date Leonardo DiCaprio. "Zendaya just turned 26. 26 is a weird age in Hollywood. Young enough to play...high school student, but too old to date Leonardo DiCaprio," Kenan joked. The crowd can be heard laughing at Kenan's joke.

180.title: I believed that we need such a story: Mrunal Thakur on 'Sita Ramam'
180.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said she signed for 'Sita Ramam' in 2020 and added that people questioned her decision to sign a Telugu film after featuring in Bollywood films. "People do Telugu films and then come to Bollywood. I believed in the story [of 'Sita Ramam'] and my character. I believed that we need such a story," she further stated.

181.title: 'Arvind Advertisement Party': Cong on AAP over ads in Guj by Punjab govt
181.article_body: Congress on Tuesday accused AAP of getting its Punjab government to spend on advertisements in poll-bound Gujarat, calling it the "Arvind Advertisement Party". Congress alleged that the Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government doesn't have money to pay salaries, but spent ₹36 crore on advertisements. AAP has spent about ₹490 crore on advertisements in 2021-22, said Congress leader Ajoy Kumar.

182.title: Gyanvapi ruling a clear violation of Places of Worship Act: CPI(M)
182.article_body: The CPI(M) has said that the Varanasi district court's decision to allow the petitions in the Gyanvapi Mosque case is a "clear violation" of the Places of Worship Act, 1991. "Wrong interpretations of the law...will lead to serious consequences," said the party. The court said the Act did not apply here as the idols were allegedly present in the mosque.

183.title: Audit  oxygen shortage COVID-19 deaths: Parliament panel to govt
183.article_body: A parliamentary committee has recommended that the Union Health Ministry "audit deaths due to oxygen shortage", especially during the COVID-19 second wave. The panel said it was "disturbed" by the ministry's "unfortunate denial" of COVID-19 deaths due to oxygen shortage. The committee added that it had warned the government of a possible shortage but they were given 'false assurances'.

184.title: Lineman drowns while trying to restore power hit by rains near B'luru
184.article_body: A lineman of Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) drowned in a lake while trying to restore power which got affected by heavy rains in Karnataka's Tumakuru district. The 38-year-old had to swim in the Tippur lake to reach the pole point. BESCOM has announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh for his family and a job for his wife.

185.title: 2 men hired for a paint job kill shopkeeper for ₹40,000 in Delhi
185.article_body: Two men, who were contracted by a shopkeeper in Delhi's Jamia Nagar to paint his house and shop, killed him for ₹40,000, police said on Tuesday. The accused during the investigation revealed that they saw the deceased had a balance of ₹40,000 in his online wallet, following which they stabbed him multiple times, said Esha Pandey, DCP (south-east district).

186.title: Thane woman arrested for abusive Facebook comments on Amruta Fadnavis
186.article_body: A Thane-based woman was arrested for allegedly making derogatory comments on a Facebook post by Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's wife, Amruta Fadnavis. The accused allegedly used a fake Facebook account, by the name of Ganesh Kapoor, to use inappropriate language. Notably, Facebook had suspended the accused's original account for posting abusive content in 2021.

187.title: Cheers to amazing menu & location: Harnaaz on Priyanka's restaurant
187.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu recently visited Priyanka Chopra's restaurant, Sona, in New York. Sandhu shared a picture on her Instagram Stories and wrote, "Cheers to amazing menu, staff and location." Harnaaz, who is in New York to attend the New York Fashion Week 2022, wore a long beige dress and high heels for her outing.

188.title: Julia Fox and her son wear matching outfits to New York Fashion Week
188.article_body: Model-actress Julia Fox matched her outfit with her 20-month-old son Valentino for a New York Fashion Week show, which was held on Friday. Fox wore a black pleather dress and thigh-high pointed boots, while her son wore a black romper and black Crocs. Fox shares her son with ex-husband Peter Artemiev.

189.title: Info provided by FB could support Myanmar war crimes allegations: UN
189.article_body: The head of the Independent Investigative Mechanism for Myanmar (IIMM) said Facebook handed over millions of items that could support genocide and war crime allegations. Myanmar is facing genocide charges at the International Court of Justice over a military crackdown on the Rohingya in 2017. Facebook has supported calls for accountability for crimes against Rohingya.

190.title: It was my mother's dream to see me on 'The Kapil Sharma Show': Gaurav Dubey
190.article_body: Comedian Gaurav Dubey, who plays a character named Roopmati on 'The Kapil Sharma Show', said in an interview that it was his mother's dream to see him on the show. He said Kapil Sharma is "amazing", adding that the 41-year-old actor-comedian teaches him "like a Guru". "I've a feeling that I'll learn a lot from my stint in...show," said Gaurav.

191.title: Alia Bhatt is the only person I feel competitive with: Varun Dhawan
191.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said Alia Bhatt is the only person he feels competitive with. "With Alia Bhatt's smashing big openings, as a male actor, I seek inspiration from that and aspire to do it too as a performer," Varun added. He said the society needs to accept that "our female leads can also be bigger than heroes".

192.title: BJP MLA Eatala Rajender suspended from Telangana Assembly
192.article_body: The BJP MLA from Huzurabad, Eatala Rajender, has been suspended from the Telangana Legislative Assembly over his alleged objectionable remarks against Assembly Speaker Pocharam Srinivas Reddy. He has been suspended for the rest of the ongoing session of the House. Reportedly, Rajender had recently said that the Speaker should not be a robot in the hands of the CM.

193.title: Survey of private & RSS schools should be done: Owaisi on survey of madrassas
193.article_body: While reacting to the move to conduct a survey of madrassas in UP and Uttarakhand, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday said it's a targeted survey against the Muslim community. "Survey of private schools, missionary schools, government schools and RSS schools should happen. Doing a survey of unaided madrassas is a targeted survey and is wrong," he added.

194.title: We'll make it through this winter: Germany's Scholz on energy crisis
194.article_body: While speaking at an event in Berlin, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said new liquefied natural gas terminals will be ready for imports by 2023 end. "We will...be able to import all the gas we need independently of Russia," Scholz added. Government is seeking to ensure that some nuclear power plants can remain running until next spring to avoid energy bottlenecks.

195.title: SEBI has no role in new-age tech firms' IPO pricing: SEBI Chief
195.article_body: Referring to the pricing of the initial share sale of new-age technology companies, SEBI Chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch said, "Our view is simple at what price you chose to do your IPO is your business, we have no business to suggest otherwise." She added, "The days of the Controller of Capital Issue are long gone."

196.title: Police vehicle torched, stones pelted during BJP's protest march to Bengal Secretariat
196.article_body: A police vehicle was set on fire and stones were pelted at police teams during BJP's protest march to West Bengal Secretariat Nabanna in Kolkata on Tuesday. Police used water cannons and tear gas shells to disperse BJP workers. State BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar was arrested and several other party leaders were detained during the protest against the TMC government.

197.title: DMK MP has yet again spewed hatred against one community: K Annamalai
197.article_body: The BJP criticised DMK MP A Raja and condemned his controversial remarks made against Hinduism while addressing a function in Tamil Nadu's Namakkal last week. "Sorry state of political discourse in Tamil Nadu. DMK MP has yet again spewed hatred against one community with the sole aim of appeasing others," said Tamil Nadu BJP President K Annamalai.

198.title: Court’s ruling supports BJP’s narrative: Mufti on Gyanvapi case verdict
198.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Tuesday reacted to the Varanasi district court’s order in the Gyanvapi case. "BJP has failed to eliminate unemployment, poverty and inflation. So, they want to distract people's attention. The court's ruling supports…BJP’s narrative," Mufti added. The court on Monday ruled in favour of Hindu women's petition in Gyanvapi mosque case.

199.title: Noida authority to form panel to look into dog-related issues
199.article_body: The Noida authority is planning to form a committee comprising officials, residents and experts to look into issues related to pet and stray dogs in residential areas and apartment complexes, officials informed. The committee will also help enforce mandatory pet registration and come up with rules regarding pets and stray animals, the officials added.

200.title: Won’t spare anyone: Minister says B'luru IT companies encroached stormwater drains
200.article_body: Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka has blamed the IT companies in Bengaluru for encroaching on stormwater drains. "More than 30 IT companies have encroached storm water drains, they were talking big, but many of these companies and builders have encroached," he said. "We won't spare anyone, no question of giving time to anyone," he added.

201.title: Revamped Hyd airport to be ready by 2023 with more flight services
201.article_body: The expansion work of the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad is likely to be completed by next year. More domestic and international flights will take off from the revamped airport. The airport will have 149 check-in counters and 44 immigration counters. It will be able to handle 34 million passengers per year.

202.title: William Ruto sworn in as Kenya's 5th President
202.article_body: William Ruto was sworn in as Kenya's fifth President on Tuesday following his narrow election win last month. The Supreme Court last week rejected losing candidate Raila Odinga's lawsuit challenging the election result. Ruto, who has been deputy President since 2013, takes over at a time of surging food and fuel prices, high unemployment and rising public debt.

203.title: PharmEasy parent may raise $250 mn from private equity firms: Report
203.article_body: General Atlantic (GA), Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPPIB) and Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) are considering investing about $250 million in PharmEasy's parent company API Holdings, as per a report. Existing investors like Temasek and ADQ will invest about $70-80 million through a convertible instrument. Bank of America and Morgan Stanley are its advisors for the fundraise.

204.title: Amazon Wholesale reports loss of ₹480 cr in FY22, revenue up 47%
204.article_body: Amazon's B2B arm, Amazon Wholesale (India), reported a net loss of ₹480 crore in FY22 as against a net profit of ₹43 crore in FY21. Its revenue surged by 47% to ₹4,605 crore in FY22 and its total expenses were ₹5,086 crore. Its operating revenue rose by 46.6% to ₹4,592 crore from ₹3,131.9 crore on a year-on-year basis.

205.title: 200 people attack Odisha police station over youth's detention, 8 policemen injured
205.article_body: A mob of around 200 people on Tuesday attacked a police station in Odisha's Gajapati district over a youth's detention for allegedly smuggling ganja, police said. "Protesters broke open the gate...thrashed personnel and ransacked properties. All of them were armed. At least seven to eight personnel were injured in the melee," a police officer added.

206.title: Don’t know why Babar was trying to stretch the match vs SL: Moin Khan
206.article_body: Ex-Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Moin Khan has questioned Babar Azam's captaincy in their Asia Cup 2022 final, stating that he played into Sri Lanka's hands by not setting an attacking field after reducing the Dasun Shanaka-led side to 58/5. "Don't know why he was trying to stretch the match," added Moin. Sri Lanka went on to post 170/6 in the match.

207.title: 25-yr-old woman, boyfriend arrested for killing her brother in Jharkhand
207.article_body: Police arrested a 25-year-old woman and her boyfriend on Monday for allegedly killing her 21-year-old brother in Jharkhand’s Ramgarh, police said. The mutilated body of the victim was exhumed by police on Sunday. The man was killed as he protested his sister’s relationship with the youth of another community, police stated.

208.title: Which 26 medicines have been removed by the govt from essential medicines list?
208.article_body: Health Ministry has released National List of Essential Medicines, 2022, comprising 384 drugs. The ministry has removed 26 drugs that were part of the previous NLEM, including Methyldopa, Atenolol, Alteplase, White Petrolatum, Cetrimide, Bleaching Powder, Sucralfate, Ranitidine, Erythromycin and Nicotinamide. Reasons for the deletion include safety concerns and alternatives with better efficacy.

209.title: 12-year-old Kerala boy attacked by stray dog as he rides bicycle, video surfaces
209.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was attacked by a stray dog in Kerala's Kozhikode on Sunday. A 50-second video of the attack shows the dog pouncing on the boy as he rides his bicycle and biting down on his wrist, refusing to let go. Notably, Kerala government will approach Supreme Court for permission to kill violent dogs after rise in dog attacks.

210.title: Used to feel envious of contemporaries when they were doing better work: Pavail
210.article_body: Actor Pavail Gulati, who starred in films like 'Dobaaraa' and 'Thappad', in an interview said, "I used to feel envious of my contemporaries when they were doing better work." He added that he feels "better" today because he's also doing "nicer work". "I'm working with people I...wanted to work with and even they're keen to work with me," said Pavail.

211.title: It's clear, England can win the Ashes next year: Michael Vaughan
211.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said he's convinced that Ben Stokes-led England can win the Ashes next year. "At the start of April, if you had said they had a chance to win...Ashes next year, we would've said there was no way they could do it," added Vaughan. Under Stokes, England have won six of their seven Tests so far.

212.title: Debt-ridden farmer ends life in Maha's Nagpur, 5th death in a month
212.article_body: A 60-year-old debt-ridden farmer allegedly died by suicide in Maharashtra's Nagpur district after his crop got damaged due to heavy rains. Rajiv Baburao Judpe was found dead at his farm on Monday, police said. He reportedly owned 2.5 acres of land and had taken loan from a bank. Notably, this is the fifth such case in a month in Nagpur.

213.title: Noida residents to soon get e-cycles on rent
213.article_body: The Noida Authority will soon get about 620 electric bicycles at 62 docking stations across Noida, commencing the city's first public bike-sharing (PBS) system within the next three months. Two companies have been selected for the project and will manage different docking stations. Each station will have 10 cycles, but the number might increase depending on the demand.

214.title: German man jailed for life for killing cashier who told him to wear mask
214.article_body: A 50-year-old German man was jailed for life on Tuesday for shooting dead a petrol station cashier, who refused to sell him beer and demanded that he wear a face mask, in September 2021. The accused, Mario N, had turned himself in last year after police launched a large-scale manhunt. According to authorities, Mario said he'd acted "out of anger".

215.title: Bharti Telecom plans to raise ₹6,000 cr of debt via NCDs: Report
215.article_body: Bharti Airtel promoter Bharti Telecom is planning to raise ₹6,000 crore in debt through non-convertible debentures (NCDs) to buy the remaining 3.33% stake in Airtel sold by Singapore Telecommunications (Singtel), as per a report. Last week, Singtel sold 1.76% in Airtel, of which Bharti Telecom acquired 1.62%. The NCDs are expected to have between one and three-year maturities.

216.title: I follow Dr Ambedkar, I cultivate minds through my art: Ranjith
216.article_body: Filmmaker Pa Ranjith has said that he follows Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar. "He always said cultivation of the mind should be the ultimate aim of human existence. I'm doing it through my art," the filmmaker further added. Ranjith stated that films in India are not only an entertainment medium. Ranjith was named 'Filmmaker of the Decade' at the OTTplay Awards 2022.

217.title: 43 animals dead, 21 districts affected due to lumpy skin disease in Maha
217.article_body: About 43 cattle died and 21 districts have been affected due to lumpy skin disease in Maharashtra, the state's animal husbandry department said on Tuesday. The maximum deaths due to the disease were reported in Jalgaon at 17. While there are no restrictions on abattoirs in the state, illegal transport of cattle has been prohibited, the animal husbandry department stated.

218.title: Central Railway sets up e-vehicle charging facilities at 9 stations in Mumbai
218.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) has set up nine electric vehicle charging facilities in Mumbai. The stations where these facilities have been provided are - Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, Dadar, Byculla, Parel, Kurla, Lokmanya Tilak Terminus, Bhandup, Kalyan and Panvel. The charging facility will be functional 24 hours and is expected to augment infrastructure for EVs to operate smoothly, CR said.

219.title: Hyderabad gets 21-metre-long foot-over bridge with elevators at Kattedan
219.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) on Monday opened a new foot-over bridge to the public at Kattedan near Swapna Theatre in Rajendra Nagar Circle. The 21-metre-long bridge has two lifts that can carry 10 passengers each. "The facility will benefit around 5,000 persons daily and has eight CCTV cameras for their safety," Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal said during the inauguration.

220.title: Truck driver arrested from UP for morphing pics of 85 women with porn content
220.article_body: Faridabad Police have arrested a 42-year-old truck driver, Ganesh, from Uttar Pradesh for allegedly blackmailing 85 women by sending them their morphed photos superimposed with pornographic content and threatening to circulate the photos. Police said he blackmailed women for sexual favours and several women considered killing themselves. Police added they found 485 obscene videos in his phone.

221.title: Robbers cut BJP MLA's mother's ears to steal her gold earrings in UP
221.article_body: The 80-year-old mother of BJP MLA Pradeep Chaudhary, Santosh Devi, was robbed of her gold earrings in UP's Ghaziabad on Tuesday when she was on her morning walk. The robbers, who fled from the scene, cut her ears with a cutter, reports said. She was immediately taken to a nearby hospital and given first aid.

222.title: US marketing firm offers 10% hike to staff on notice period, Founder shares post
222.article_body: A marketing firm in the US offers its employees a 10% hike if they agree to serve at least six weeks’ notice period. Gorilla's Founder Jon Franko wrote on LinkedIn, "And we promise, no hard feelings. This encourages our people to do something different if they're feeling stuck...It also gives us time to prepare for how we'll move forward."

223.title: We'll be watching Tiafoe dominate in the years to come: Michelle Obama
223.article_body: The former First Lady of the US Michelle Obama took to Twitter to praise 24-year-old Frances Tiafoe for his recent performances. "I have a feeling we'll all be watching Tiafoe dominate in the years to come," she wrote on Twitter. Tiafoe became the first American man since 2006 to enter the semi-finals at the US Open in the recently-concluded edition.

224.title: After Narendra Modi, BJP planning to make Sonia Gandhi the PM: Kejriwal
224.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said after PM Narendra Modi, BJP is "planning to make [Congress chief] Sonia Gandhi the Prime Minister". "Do ask [BJP] this question that Sonia ji is being considered as a PM candidate for Modi ji's successor. What do they have to say about that?" Kejriwal said. "Congress is finished," he added.

225.title: Amit Shah's muffler costs ₹80,000: Gehlot amid Rahul's T-shirt row
225.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Monday claimed that Home Minister Amit Shah's muffler costs ₹80,000. Gehlot said, "[BJP is] talking about Rahul Gandhi's T-shirt while [BJP leaders] themselves wear sunglasses of ₹2.5 lakh and muffler of ₹80,000." This comes after BJP tweeted a picture of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi wearing a Burberry T-shirt purportedly worth ₹41,257 during 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

226.title: Which world leaders will attend Queen Elizabeth's funeral on September 19?
226.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden are among the world leaders who've confirmed their presence at Queen Elizabeth's funeral in London. Australian, New Zealand and Canadian PMs Anthony Albanese, Jacinda Ardern and Justin Trudeau are also set to attend it. Presidents of Brazil, Italy, Germany, Sri Lanka and the King and Queen of Spain will also attend.

227.title: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi to visit Rajasthan on Sept 14, 15
227.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi will visit Rajasthan on September 14 and 15 to strengthen the party's political base, state convener Jameel Khan said. This will be AIMIM's first public programme in Rajasthan after Owaisi announced his party will fight the state Assembly elections next year. Owaisi will hold a meeting with the core group members on September 14, Khan added.

228.title: Multilevel parking at Sadar Bazar will be ready by March 2023: Officials
228.article_body: The multilevel parking at Sadar Bazar is likely to be constructed by March next year, officials of the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) said. The parking near Sohna Chowk can accommodate around 206 cars and 190 two-wheelers, officials added. Three basement floors have been reserved for basement parking and six floors above are primarily reserved for commercial shops, officials said.

229.title: Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board starts monitoring of night shelters
229.article_body: As the need for night shelters in the national capital grows, the Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board (DUSIB) has started community-based monitoring of its 195 night shelters and public restrooms, which are used by nearly 25 lakh people everyday. A centralised control room has also been established for complaints over the phone, WhatsApp, text messages, etc.

230.title: Lufthansa raises pilots' salary, enters truce period with union
230.article_body: German airline Lufthansa has agreed to increase the pay of the pilots by €980 after the frequent strike calls from them. Lufthansa and the German pilots' union, Vereinigung Cockpit have also entered a truce period, which will run until June 30, 2023, during which there will be no strikes. The agreement is subject to approval by responsible bodies, Lufthansa said.

231.title: 2 Co-founders of US-based firm Peloton to step down amid restructuring
231.article_body: John Foley and Hisao Kushi, Co-founders of New York-based Peloton Interactive Inc, will step down from executive roles. Company's board member, Karen Boone, will replace Foley while former Uber Technologies Inc executive, Tammy Albarran, will succeed Kushi. The firm that makes fitness equipment decided to cut jobs, hike prices and list its products on Amazon since it started incurring losses.

232.title: 1st pics of Orion Nebula captured by world's most powerful telescope released
232.article_body: An international research team on Monday revealed first images of the Orion Nebula captured with James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. The images were obtained as part of the Early Release Science program and involved more than 100 scientists in 18 countries. "We're blown away by the breathtaking images of...Orion Nebula," astrophysicist Els Peeters stated.

233.title: Ex-world no. 1 Halep undergoes nose surgery, out for a few weeks
233.article_body: Two-time Grand Slam champion Simona Halep announced that she underwent nose surgery and would need a few weeks of rest before she can start with any physical activity. The ex-world number one added that she was "struggling for a while with nose problems", making it difficult to breathe especially at night. Halep lost in first round of US Open 2022.

234.title: Bridge over Hindon river on GT Road to open by Sept 20: Ghaziabad authority
234.article_body: Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) on Saturday said that the new bridge over Hindon river on the GT Road stretch is likely to be opened to traffic by September 20. The new bridge will provide two additional lanes for traffic between Ghaziabad and Mohan Nagar. The bridge is located close to three other bridges that connect Vasundhara, Mohan Nagar and Ghaziabad.

235.title: Nagpur couple consumes poison after parents oppose marriage, woman dies
235.article_body: A 22-year-old woman died while the man that she was in a relationship with was hospitalised after they consumed poison following opposition from parents for their marriage. Police said that a case of accidental death has been registered. The two were rushed to the hospital after consuming poison.

236.title: Puducherry girl eats rat poison after mistaking it for cake, dies
236.article_body: A 14-year-old girl died on Monday after she ate rat poison mistaking it for a chocolate cake in Karaikal of Puducherry, a report said. The girl, who was suffering from general dystonia (a movement disorder), complained of ill health and started vomiting after consuming the rat poison. She was later taken to a hospital, however, she died while undergoing treatment.

237.title: China-Russia relationship on the right track: Beijing
237.article_body: The relationship between Russia and China is "on the right track", senior Chinese diplomat Yang Jiechi told Russian envoy Andrey Denisov on Monday. Jiechi added, "[China is] willing to work with Russia to continuously implement the spirit of high-level strategic cooperation between the two countries...and promote the development of the international order in a more just and rational direction."

238.title: Illegal madrassa demolished in UP's Amethi
238.article_body: The district administration in Amethi demolished a madrassa constructed illegally on land meant for grazing animals. The administration also imposed a fine of ₹2.24 lakh on the owner of the madrassa. Earlier, the UP government had ordered a survey of unrecognised madrassas to gather information on the number of teachers, curriculum and their affiliation with any non-government organisations.

239.title: 'Brahmastra' sequel to go on floors by the end of 2022: Report
239.article_body: Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra: Part two Dev' will reportedly go on floors by the end of 2022 or early 2023. "Ayan has more or less written the script for the entire Trilogy before he started shooting Part One," a source revealed. "Karan Johar and his co-producers Fox-Star are keen to kick-off Part 2 sooner rather than later," the source added.

240.title: Feet blisters won't stop us from uniting India: Rahul Gandhi
240.article_body: As Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' entered its third day in Kerala on Tuesday, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that feet blisters won't stop the party from uniting India. "India's dream is broken, not scattered. To realise that dream, we are bringing India together. 100 km done. And, we have just begun," Gandhi had said on Monday.

241.title: Father, son accidentally inhales LPG after gas leak in Vasai, saved
241.article_body: A man and his 10-year-old son accidentally inhaled liquified petroleum gas (LPG) after a gas leak in their laundry shop-cum-residence in Vasai on Saturday. Police took the help of locals and broke down the shop's shutters and found the man and his son lying unconscious. They were later taken to a nearby hospital and regained consciousness after a few hours.

242.title: 49 soldiers killed in border clashes with Azerbaijan: Armenia
242.article_body: Armenia said at least 49 of its troops were killed in clashes with Azerbaijan, the worst fighting between the countries since their 2020 war over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region. "The intensity of hostilities has decreased but attacks on one or two fronts from Azerbaijan continue," Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan said. Russia and US have called both countries to observe restraint.

243.title: Video shows students made to study in portacabins in Delhi govt school
243.article_body: A video showing students made to study in makeshift portacabins in a government-run school in East Delhi was reported by ANI. For last few years, the Delhi government has been reportedly using portacabins for classrooms as construction of new buildings isn't completed or they haven't been handed over to institutions. The school's principal has reportedly refused to answer any questions.

244.title: 2 IEDs recovered from Maoist-hit Dantewada in Chhattisgarh
244.article_body: Two powerful improvised explosive devices (IEDs), suspected to have been planted by Maoists, were recovered by security forces in Chhattisgarh's Dantewada district on Monday. The explosives, weighing 10 kg each, were recovered by a CRPF team during a road security operation from beneath the earth, PTI reported. A bomb disposal squad later neutralised the explosives, an official said.

245.title: 3 kidnap 9-yr-old from Gurugram, demand ₹50 lakh ransom; held
245.article_body: Police on Saturday arrested three people for allegedly kidnapping a nine-year-old from Gurugram's Bhondsi and demanding ₹50 lakh as ransom. Police said that the suspects were friends of the victim's family and committed the crime over a financial dispute. The accused's husband had taken a loan from the victim's father and hatched the kidnapping plan to repay the amount.

246.title: 50 mn people in modern slavery amid COVID, conflicts and climate crisis: ILO
246.article_body: The International Labour Organization (ILO) has said the number of people forced into modern forms of slavery has risen to around 50 million in recent years. This involved people who "cannot refuse or cannot leave because of threats, violence, deception or abuse of power", ILO added. Armed conflicts, COVID-19 crisis and climate change worsened the situation.

247.title: Vedanta-Foxconn to make Atmanirbhar Silicon Valley a reality: Agarwal
247.article_body: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal took to Twitter and said, "Vedanta's landmark investment of ₹1.54 lakh crore will help make India's Atmanirbhar Silicon Valley a reality." He also said the Vedanta-Foxconn joint venture will "reduce our electronics imports and provide 1 lakh direct skilled jobs to our people". Foxconn will be the technical partner, while Vedanta will finance the project.

248.title: Like Hanuman, you don't believe in your capacity: FM to India Inc
248.article_body: Referring to India Inc, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman asked what was preventing them from entering the manufacturing sector even as other countries are showing confidence in India. "Is it like Hanuman that you don't believe in your own capacity and strength," she asked, adding that the government was ready to hear the industry and act on what is presented.

249.title: 8-month-old baby dies in UP after mobile kept on charging near her explodes
249.article_body: An eight-month-old infant girl was killed after she suffered burn injuries when the battery of a mobile phone kept next to her for charging exploded in Uttar Pradesh. The mobile phone, reportedly belonging to Lava, was being charged through a solar panel. Her parents said that the phone was purchased nearly six months ago and its battery was swollen lately.

250.title: Cancer should be classified as notifiable disease: Parliamentary panel
250.article_body: The Parliamentary Standing Committee on Health and Family Welfare recommended that cancer be classified as a notifiable disease. The 139th report on "Cancer Care Plan and Management: Prevention, Diagnosis, Research and Affordability of Cancer Treatment" was submitted to RS Chairman. "Cancer still isn't classified as notifiable disease which results in underreporting of...deaths," report read.

251.title: Supply chain startup Procol raises ₹51 cr in Series A round
251.article_body: Supply chain startup Procol has raised ₹51 crore in its Series A equity financing round. The round saw participation from existing investors Blume Ventures, Beenext and Sequoia Surge, along with GMO VenturePartners, Alarko Ventures and angel investors Kunal Shah (CRED), Razorpay founders, Deb Deep Sengupta (SAP India), among others. Procol was founded in 2018 by Gaurav Baheti and Sumit Mendiratta.

252.title: Locals catch 'devil fish' amid floods in Hyderabad; video emerges
252.article_body: A suckermouth catfish, also known as devil fish, was recently found in floodwaters by residents of Hyderabad's Ramanthapur. A video showed a woman holding the fish in her bare hands while neighbours gathered around her to catch a glimpse of the creature. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department predicted that Hyderabad would receive light to moderate rain and thundershowers till Friday.

253.title: 47-yr-old man ends life over harassment from loan agents in Gurugram
253.article_body: A 47-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Gurugram's Sector 7 after being harassed by three loan recovery agents, police said on Monday. According to police, the deceased's family members recovered a suicide note, that mentioned he was being harassed. "We've obtained call detail records of...three suspects. They'll be served notices to appear for questioning," a police official said.

254.title: Police officer, 1 other shot dead by man in Canada; 3 injured
254.article_body: A Toronto traffic police officer was shot dead along with another person in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) of Canada's Ontario province on Monday by a man who was later neutralised by police, officials said. Three people were also injured in the shootings which spanned three locations in the GTA. No motive for the shooting has been revealed by police.

255.title: Vedanta, Foxconn to invest ₹1,54,000 cr in Guj for semiconductor plant
255.article_body: Vedanta and Taiwan's Foxconn have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government to invest ₹1,54,000 crore for setting up a display fabrication and semiconductor facility in the state. Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel said that the facility will create one lakh job opportunities. Foxconn is acting as the technical partner, while Vedanta will be financing the project.

256.title: Cong MLAs dump garlic at MP Assembly gate accusing govt of ignoring farmers
256.article_body: Congress MLAs dumped garlic at the MP Assembly gate on Tuesday, accusing the BJP-led government of not protecting farmers. "The state government is not purchasing garlic from farmers and this has resulted in a steep fall in the produce's price," said former Agriculture Minister Sachin Yadav. Farmers are unable to cover even the input cost of farming, he added.

257.title: Pune likely to witness rainfall till September 14
257.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert in ghat regions in Pune and surrounding areas till September 14. Rainfall is likely to be moderate during this period in Pune. Heavy rains lashed Pune on Sunday, causing waterlogging and power cuts in several areas. Several instances of trees falling were also reported in the city.

258.title: Delhi Police Special Cell arrests man for attacking PCR vans in 2021
258.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a man, Javed alias Jabid, for allegedly attacking four Police Control Room (PCR) patrolling vans in 2021. According to the police, the accused is a proclaimed offender and was absconding for over a year. He was involved in 15 heinous cases of crime in Delhi and Haryana, Delhi Police said.

259.title: They didn't do anything extraordinary: Dean Elgar on losing 3rd England Test
259.article_body: South Africa Test captain Dean Elgar has said England didn't do anything extraordinary in their nine-wicket win in three days in the final Test. "I thought they played the correct tempo...they were striking when they needed to strike," he stated. Elgar further said that the 11-day break after the second Test was something that "needs to be looked at".

260.title: 13-year-old killed, another injured as bus hits them in Telangana
260.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was killed and a boy injured on their way to school after getting hit by a bus in Telangana's Ibrahimpatnam town on Tuesday. The incident occurred when the driver was making a U-turn and failed to see the students, said police. While the driver is absconding, a case has been registered for causing death by negligence.

261.title: Journalist Siddique Kappan to remain in jail despite release order
261.article_body: Kerala-based journalist Siddique Kappan will continue to remain in jail as a case being probed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against him is still pending, prison department officials said. A Lucknow court on Monday issued Kappan's release order. Notably, Supreme Court recently granted bail to Kappan who was arrested by the UP government under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act.

262.title: Kangana Ranaut thinks Dharma Productions is also under Centre: Kunal
262.article_body: Comedian Kunal Kamra took to Twitter and wrote that actress Kangana Ranaut thinks that Karan Johar's Dharma Productions is also under the central government. "Kangana thinks, like ED, NIA, CBI, Dharma Productions is also under central government," Kunal tweeted. This comes after Kangana accused Karan of manipulating box office numbers of Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Brahmastra'.

263.title: WB Police uses tear gas, water cannons to disperse protesting BJP workers
263.article_body: West Bengal Police used water cannons and tear gas to disperse BJP workers during their protest march to state Secretariat Nabanna in Kolkata on Tuesday. Buses on the way to Kolkata to participate in the march were stopped by police in North 24 Parganas. Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari, BJP MP Locket Chatterjee and party leader Rahul Sinha were detained.

264.title: Moving in right direction: Savita on 'Goalkeeper of the Year' award nomination
264.article_body: Indian women's hockey team goalkeeper Savita Punia said that being nominated for FIH women's 'Goalkeeper of the Year' award 2021-22 makes her feel that she's moving in the right direction in training. "The coaching staff and...players have been quite supportive. We've always worked together in every competition," she added. Savita had won the same award in the last edition.

265.title: Pune Collector reviews measures taken at road accident-prone areas
265.article_body: Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh reviewed corrective measures taken at road accident-prone 'black spots'. Norms set up by the Centre describe a 'black spot' as an area of 500 metres of the road on which five or more accidents with deaths or serious injuries have taken place in three years. The review was done at district-level road safety committee meeting.

266.title: Pune banker attempts to rape his 19-year-old stepdaughter; booked
266.article_body: A 51-year-old banker has been booked on the charge of an attempt to rape his 19-year-old stepdaughter in Pune, officials said. The victim in her complaint said the accused tried to touch her inappropriately without her permission and tried to rape her on Sunday. "The medical examination of the girl has been done and the report is awaited," police said.

267.title: Russia detains man suspected of sending military aircraft pics to Ukraine
267.article_body: Russia has detained a top manager of an aviation factory on suspicion of passing secret military information to Ukraine, local news agencies reported, citing the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB). The man is suspected of taking pictures of equipment from Russian fighter planes and sending them to a Ukrainian national, who worked at an aviation plant in Ukraine, reports stated.

268.title: Stampede at stadium in Kenya ahead of presidential inauguration, many injured
268.article_body: People in Kenya's Nairobi forced their way into a stadium where William Ruto will be inaugurated as President. Police baton-charged people as they broke through barriers, causing stampede at Kasarani stadium. Report said 60 people have been injured and most of them have been rushed to the main hospital in Nairobi. Ruto narrowly won the election against Raila Odinga.

269.title: Rani attends Aditya's DDLJ Broadway show, poses with lead actors
269.article_body: Rani Mukerji watched her filmmaker-husband Aditya Chopra's 'Come Fall In Love', a Broadway musical based on 'Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge'. She also posed with lead actors Shoba Narayan, who plays Simran, and Austin Colby, who essays the role based on Shah Rukh Khan's Raj. "So thrilling to have you in...audience last night," Shoba wrote while sharing pictures with Rani.

270.title: Google faces $25.4 bn damages lawsuit over anti-competitive adtech practices
270.article_body: Google is facing a $25.4 billion damages claim lawsuit in the UK and EU over its alleged anti-competitive practices in the digital advertising industry. Publishers have long been harmed by Google's anti-competitive conduct, an official of one of the law firms involved in the suits said. UK's competition watchdog is also investigating Google's power in the digital advertising technology market.

271.title: In Bengal, Mamata is enforcing dictatorship similar to North Korea: BJP leader
271.article_body: Ahead of BJP's Nabanna march in West Bengal, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari on Tuesday said that CM Mamata Banerjee does not have the support of her people so, "she is enforcing dictatorship similar to North Korea, in Bengal". Furthermore, he added, "Police will have to pay for what it's been doing since yesterday, BJP is coming."

272.title: Man strangles wife to death on suspicion of infidelity in Gurugram
272.article_body: A man was arrested after he allegedly thrashed his wife and then strangled her to death on the suspicion of infidelity in Gurugram, police said. The accused reportedly told his wife's father that she died by suicide, however, the latter didn't believe him and filed a complaint. "The accused was beating my daughter for...past one week," the wife's father claimed.

273.title: Congress worker shot dead in Himachal Pradesh's Una, probe on
273.article_body: A 40-year-old businessman and local Congress worker was shot dead by assailants near Punjab-Himachal border in Una district on Monday night. According to police, the victim, identified as Ravinder Kumar Sethi, and his nephew were walking near the Dulehar sports stadium when four men fired two shots at them. While Sethi was declared brought dead, his nephew suffered injuries.

274.title: Waterfalls appear at world's hottest place after massive flooding in US; video released
274.article_body: A video showing muddy waterfalls flowing down the mountainside in Death Valley National Park in US has been shared by park authorities. The waterfalls appeared after the area was hit by Hurricane Kay, leading to a flash flood. Death Valley National Park holds the world record for hottest temperature at 56.7°C and is also one of the world's driest places.

275.title: Mithila Palkar & Dhruv Sehgal announce audio season of 'Little Things'
275.article_body: Actress Mithila Palkar shared that the new season of 'Little Things' is an audio series. Talking about the show, titled 'Little Things: Jab Dhruv Met Kavya', Palkar said it's a "sweet, special story about how Dhruv and Kavya met". Actor-writer Dhruv Sehgal said 'Little Things' fans will find themselves listening to the series with "a goofy smile on their face".

276.title: Would've gone for Samson instead of Pant: Kaneria on India's T20 WC squad
276.article_body: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria said he would have picked Sanju Samson instead of Rishabh Pant in Team India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "It is...unfair for someone like Samson," added Kaneria. "India are repeating the same mistakes. Pant has been selected because he has an impressive record in Australia. However, his recent form hasn't been...great in T20s," he stated.

277.title: Hooda will need to play from 1st game as he's a 6th bowling option: Irfan
277.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said India should play all-rounder Deepak Hooda from their first game in the upcoming T20 WC in Australia. "Hooda is a sixth bowling option, something that India struggled for in the last World Cup," stated Irfan. "There'll be a choice...between whether they want to play a left-hander in the middle order or Hooda," he added.

278.title: 22-year-old Mumbai student loses ₹96,000 to electricity bill fraud
278.article_body: A 22-year-old Mumbai student lost ₹96,000 to electricity bill fraud from his joint bank account with his mother. The victim got a text message saying his electricity bill payment date for August had expired, and if he didn't pay the bill, the power supply would be disconnected. Notably, the amount was meant for the cancer treatment of the victim's aunt.

279.title: Global firms looking to shift manufacturing operations from China to India: FM
279.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said global companies are looking to move out from China and set up their operations in India as they believe in India's growth story. Government will do everything to create an ecosystem for the industry to invest in India, Sitharaman added. Policies like PLI and tax cuts have been provided to India's private industry, she added.

280.title: BJP workers use boat to reach Bengal Secretariat during protest march
280.article_body: A group of BJP workers used a boat to cross the Tribeni river, Hooghly to reach West Bengal Secretariat Nabanna in Kolkata amid the party's protest march against the alleged corruption by CM Mamata Banerjee's TMC. Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari and several other BJP leaders were detained during the protest march. Adhikari was leading the march from Santragachi area.

281.title: PMC launches chatbot for citizens to get property tax-related info
281.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has launched a 24-hour WhatsApp Chatbot facility for citizens to get property tax-related information. Citizens would have to send a message on 8888251001 and select options to get respective information on matters including paid and due amount and tax bill. Additional Municipal Commissioner Ravindra Binwade said, "A total of nine services are included in it."

282.title: 18-yr-old boy found dead in residential building in Thane's Mira Road
282.article_body: An 18-year-old boy was reportedly found dead in a passageway on the second floor of a residential building in Thane's Mira Road on Sunday. According to family members, he had stepped out of his flat on the third floor on Saturday night for some work and didn't return, police said. A cleaning staff of the building found him lying dead.

283.title: Hoax bomb call triggers panic at The Leela Ambience Hotel in Gurugram
283.article_body: The Leela Ambience Hotel in Gurugram received a hoax bomb threat call on Tuesday, which triggered panic at the premises. An unidentified person called the hotel's reception desk around 11:55 am, following which the police and bomb squad reached the location. However, after a thorough investigation, it was found that it was a hoax call.

284.title: SPPU, Godrej introduce certificate course for disabled soldiers
284.article_body: In collaboration with Godrej company, the Savitribai Phule Pune University is introducing a course on 'Repair and Maintenance of Household Electronic Appliances' for the disabled soldiers of Queen Mary Technical Institute. The course will be conducted for the following three months. A team of experts from Godrej, along with university teachers, will guide the enrolled soldiers in the course.

285.title: BJP-ruled central govt not releasing funds for schemes: Bihar minister
285.article_body: Bihar Finance Minister Vijay Kumar Chaudhary has alleged that the BJP-ruled central government isn't releasing funds for various welfare schemes. He told PTI that due to this "all department heads have been advised to keep in check avoidable expenses". He added that central government is "playing politics over schemes" and that state government is struggling to get its "rightful dues".

286.title: Gelatin sticks installed at Pune's Chandani chowk to demolish old bridge
286.article_body: The authorities have installed 'gelatin sticks' in the pillars of the old bridge at Pune's Chandani chowk for its demolition. "The iron girders are being installed...to shift the service pipes over the bypass highway...work is in the final stage," an official said. "Work to start service roads towards Mulshi road and the Kothrud side is underway," the official added.

287.title: KRK says he lost 10 kg in 10 days, 'survived only on water' in jail; Twitter users react
287.article_body: Kamaal R Khan, who was recently released from jail, claimed that he "was surviving [on] only water for 10 days" in jail. "So I have lost 10 kg weight," he wrote in his tweet. Reacting to this, a Twitter user commented, "How is that even medically possible?" while another person jokingly wrote, "I want to lose weight...thanks for the idea."

288.title: Luxury brands cut ties with Chinese actor Li over repeatedly hiring prostitutes
288.article_body: Global brands including Prada and Remy Martin have cut ties with Chinese superstar Li Yifeng after he was arrested for repeatedly hiring prostitutes. The 35-year-old, also known as Evan Li, is hugely popular in China, with 60 million followers on the country's Twitter-like Sina Weibo platform. Li had played Communist leader Mao Zedong in a 2021 film.

289.title: Which Indian business schools are among world's top 100 in FT's ranking?
289.article_body: Seven Indian business schools are among the world's top 100 schools for masters in management programmes, as per Financial Times 2022 ranking. While IIM Bangalore ranked 31st in global list, SP Jain Institute of Management and Research ranked 44th. The list includes IIM Lucknow, IIM Udaipur, IIM Indore, NMIMS Mumbai, School of Business Management, and International Management Institute, New Delhi.

290.title: Video shows 18-wheel trailer overturning on car after sudden turn in Punjab; 3 killed
290.article_body: A CCTV footage shows an 18-wheel loaded trailer overturning after taking a sudden turn without slowing down and crushing a car under it in Punjab's Behram. Three family members including a couple and their son, who were travelling in the car, were killed. According to reports, three more people in another car that narrowly escaped the overturned trailer were injured.

291.title: Will be a globetrotting action adventure: Rajamouli on Mahesh Babu film
291.article_body: SS Rajamouli opened up about his next film with Mahesh Babu at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). The director said the film will be "a globetrotting action adventure". "It's going to be a kind of James Bond or Indiana Jones film with Indian roots," he said. Mahesh is currently shooting for Trivikram Srinivas' next film, tentatively titled 'SSMB28'.

292.title: No music in Hyderabad pubs after 10 pm: Telangana High Court
292.article_body: The Telangana High Court has banned music or any other sound in Hyderabad pubs and bars between 10 pm and 6 am. The interim order came into effect on Monday. The court was replying to petitions regarding noise from pubs at night. The court also asked the Excise Department how pubs received licenses to operate near residential areas and schools.

293.title: Urvashi Rautela says 'I am sorry' to Rishabh Pant amid controversy, video surfaces
293.article_body: A video shared by 'Instant Bollywood' shows actress Urvashi Rautela saying "I am sorry" to Rishabh Pant amid the recent controversy. Earlier, in a viral interview, Urvashi had claimed that Pant wanted to meet her in Delhi. Pant had called it a "lie" and had urged her to leave him alone. Urvashi had later called Pant a "cougar hunter".

294.title: Doing an international project is on my wish list: Rasika Dugal
294.article_body: Rasika Dugal said she's interested in doing an international project, but she couldn't find time to work towards that dream. She said her commitments towards the subsequent seasons of her shows and some new offers kept her busy. "It's on my wish list and I'm putting it out there in the universe, hoping that it happens soon," she added.

295.title: Blue Origin's uncrewed rocket crash to face probe led by FAA
295.article_body: The FAA has announced that it will lead the investigation into the crash of Blue Origin's uncrewed rocket. It said that it will have to sign off before the firm's New Shepard vehicle can return to flight. The rocket crashed back to Earth just a minute after its launch on Monday, marking the first launch failure for the firm.

296.title: 15 JD(U) panchayat members in Daman and Diu join BJP
296.article_body: The BJP on Monday said that 15 out of 17 district panchayat members of JD(U) in Daman and Diu have joined the party. In a tweet, the party said that the members left JD(U) as Bihar CM Nitish Kumar joined hands with a 'bahubali', corrupt and dynasty-favouring party. Days ago, five Manipur JD(U) MLAs had joined the BJP.

297.title: So excited: Suhana Khan on Navya's 'What The Hell Navya' podcast
297.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan said she's "excited" about Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast 'What The Hell Navya'. Navya, the granddaughter of Amitabh Bachchan, announced the podcast on Monday. She said 'What The Hell Navya' will be a space where she'll "have fun conversations with some very special guests" and promised it'll be "raw, real, witty and deeply personal".

298.title: Mensa Brands acquires peanut butter brand MyFitness
298.article_body: Mensa Brands acquired peanut butter brand, MyFitness for an undisclosed amount. MyFitness was founded by Mohammad Patel and Rahil Virani in 2019 and has over 30 stock-keeping units with an average selling price of ₹500. Mensa was founded by Ananth Narayanan, former CEO of Myntra and Medlife. Accel Partners, Falcon Edge Capital and Tiger Global Management are among its investors.

299.title: HC judge's daughter gets bail in shooter Sippy Sidhu murder case
299.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has granted bail to Kalyani Singh, a Himachal Pradesh High Court judge's daughter, who was arrested over the murder of national-level shooter Sippy Sidhu. A detailed order is awaited, one of Singh's lawyers said. The CBI had told a court that the murder, which took place in 2015, occurred after Singh and Sidhu's relationship soured.

300.title: Construction-tech firm 91Squarefeet raises $10 mn in Series A round
300.article_body: Construction-tech firm 91Squarefeet secured $10 million in a Series A funding round led by Stellaris Venture Partners. The round saw participation of existing investors like US-based Y Combinator, Hong Kong-based Betatron Venture Group and some angel investors. Gurugram-based company was founded by Amit Bansal, Puneet Bansal and Amit Mishra, who had co-founded a logistics-focused startup Quifers.

301.title: Osmania University girl students protest over quality of food at hostel
301.article_body: Girl students of Hyderabad's Osmania University staged a sit-in protest over the quality of food that was being served in the varsity hostel. Students staying in the Ladies Hostel Complex alleged that they found a broken bangle piece in the food. Despite paying ₹12,000-₹18,000 mess fee per annum, the hostel serves watery sambar and hard rice, a student said.

302.title: North Korea will self-destruct if it uses nuclear weapons: South Korea
302.article_body: South Korea on Tuesday warned North Korea that using its nuclear weapons would put it on a "path of self-destruction". This comes days after North Korea passed a new law allowing it to carry out a preemptive nuclear attack to protect itself. Pyongyang's new law would prompt Seoul and Washington to "further strengthen their...reaction capacities", South Korea's Defence Ministry said.

303.title: Ukrainian forces outnumbered Russian troops: Russia-installed official
303.article_body: A Russia-installed official in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, Vitaly Ganchev, said Ukrainian forces outnumbered Russian and pro-Russian forces by eight times during a counteroffensive. Ganchev told a state-owned television channel "the situation is becoming more difficult by the hour". On Sunday, Russian Defence Ministry published a map showing that its forces had abandoned the Kharkiv region.

304.title: If Rohit was half as fit as Kohli, he'd be the most destructive player: Salman
304.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Salman Butt has said Rohit Sharma would've been the "most destructive player" if his fitness levels were half as good as Virat Kohli's. Butt added that had Rohit been "very fit" like Kohli, then only AB de Villiers could be compared with him. "Rohit can't be compared with Babar and Rizwan," he further said.

305.title: India to host G20 summit in September 2023
305.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has confirmed that India will be hosting the G20 leaders' summit in New Delhi on September 9 and 10 in 2023. India will take over the presidency of G20 from Indonesia, which is set to host the leaders' summit in November this year. India is expected to host over 200 meetings across the country.

306.title: Papua New Guinea proclaims King Charles III as head of state
306.article_body: Papua New Guinea leaders held a ceremony to proclaim King Charles III as the country's new head of state and to acknowledge the passing away of Queen Elizabeth II. PM James Marape will meet the new King on Friday. Papua New Guinea is one of five countries in Asia and the Pacific where the British monarch is head of state.

307.title: UK unemployment rate falls to 48-year low as people quit labour market
307.article_body: Britain's unemployment rate fell to 3.6% in the May-July period as more people left the labour market, official figures showed. This is the lowest it has been since 1974. The number of people in employment grew by 40,000 in the three months, the Office for National Statistics said. The economic inactivity rate increased by 0.4 percentage points to 21.7%.

308.title: Parts of Kolkata witness waterlogging after heavy rainfall
308.article_body: Kolkata witnessed heavy rainfall on Tuesday, which led to waterlogging in several parts. Areas including Golf Green and Lake Gardens in the city were reportedly waterlogged. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) predicted the temperature to hover between 25 °C and 28 °C. Heavy rains were also witnessed in the southern region of West Bengal.

309.title: Feel lucky to be part of 'Uunchai': Anupam shares pics with Big B, Boman
309.article_body: Veteran actor Anupam Kher on Tuesday shared a series of pictures with 'Uunchai' director Sooraj Barjatya and co-stars Amitabh Bachchan and Boman Irani. The actor wrote in the caption, "I feel special and lucky to be part of this magnum opus directed by God's own child #SoorajBarjatya. Proud to be working with a great team of actors and technicians!"

310.title: Bombay HC dismisses Rabia's plea seeking reinvestigation of Jiah's case
310.article_body: Bombay High Court on Monday dismissed late actress Jiah Khan's mother Rabia's plea seeking a fresh investigation in the nine-year-old case. Jiah committed suicide on June 3, 2013 at her Mumbai residence. As per Rabia, Jiah was murdered. The case was probed by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) which charged Jiah's boyfriend actor Sooraj Pancholi with abetting her suicide.

311.title: BJP keeps changing CMs, Cong is finished: Arvind Kejriwal in Gujarat
311.article_body: Ahead of the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal, during his visit to the state, said that the Bharatiya Janata Party keeps changing Chief Ministers and the Indian National Congress is finished. "Let's stop taking questions about them," he told the media while talking about Congress. He also got into an argument with Gujarat Police.

312.title: King Charles, siblings hold silent vigil for Queen Elizabeth II
312.article_body: King Charles III and his siblings held a silent vigil at the side of their mother Queen Elizabeth II's coffin, which lay at rest in Edinburgh's historic cathedral on Monday. King Charles alongside his sister Princess Anne and brothers Prince Andrew and Prince Edward, stood solemnly for 10 minutes next to the coffin, draped with the royal flag.

313.title: BJP leaders Suvendu Adhikari, Locket Chatterjee detained during Nabanna march
313.article_body: BJP leaders, Suvendu Adhikari, Locket Chatterjee, Tapasi Mondal and Dibakar Gharami were detained during the Nabanna march in West Bengal. News agency ANI reported that the leaders were taken to Kolkata Police headquarters in Lalbazar. Meanwhile, Adhikari said that state Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is enforcing a dictatorship like North Korea.

314.title: Jet Airways CEO shares pic of kid out of sunroof of car; asks 'Where have we failed?'
314.article_body: Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor tweeted a picture and wrote, "Kid enjoying the breeze out of the sunroof as his car zips along [in] Gurugram. Where have we failed? In schooling, or parenting, or both?" Stating this can be a "good case study", Kapoor said, "While the majority see the danger, there are those that see nothing wrong in this."

315.title: AAP promises law for lawyers' protection if it comes to power in Gujarat
315.article_body: Ahead of Gujarat polls, AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal promised a law for the protection of advocates and a scheme to provide fresh law graduates a ₹5,000 monthly stipend if the party comes to power. "Lawyers are very powerful. If all the lawyers get united and determined then they can make any party win or lose," said Kejriwal.

316.title: Akshay was told 'Tumhari aukat nai hain ki film ke poster lag sake': Darshan
316.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Akshay Kumar before the release of 'Jaanwar', director-producer Suneel Darshan stated, "Akshay...said, 'Suneel ji, I'm going through so many problems'." "The producer of the movie which released on Friday hasn't put up posters...[He]...told me, 'You're not at the status where your film posters and hoardings can be put up'," added Darshan, recalling Akshay's words.

317.title: Delhi LG can't enjoy power without accountability: AAP's Saurabh Bharadwaj
317.article_body: After the Delhi High Court directed that a PIL be filed over the deaths of two manual scavengers in Delhi's Mundka, AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said that the Delhi LG VK Saxena cannot "enjoy power without accountability". "The DDA, which comes directly under the LG, is responsible for these two deaths," Bharadwaj added.

318.title: 7-star resort worth ₹200 cr in Kerala to be demolished over coastal rules violations
318.article_body: A seven-star resort worth ₹200 crore, situated on an island in the backwaters of the Vembanad Lake in Kerala's Alappuzha, will be demolished for violating Coastal Regulation Zone rules. This comes after the Kerala government took back possession of a piece of land from Kapico Kerala Resorts Private Limited. Supreme Court in 2020 had ordered the demolition of the resort.

319.title: NYT offers lunch boxes as return to work perk, staff says 'we want fair contracts'
319.article_body: The New York Times offered its staff branded lunch boxes as a return-to-office perk as hundreds of them protested against the move, demanding fair contracts instead. An employee, while sharing the lunch box's photo, wrote, "My colleagues and I don't need cute trinkets. 330 of us wrote emails...asking for real raises to combat inflation….What we need is a contract."

320.title: Sunny took signing money for film but refused to honour commitment: Producer
320.article_body: Producer Suneel Darshan has spoken about his falling out with actor Sunny Deol in an interview, saying that the actor took the signing fee for a film and later refused to honour the commitment. He further said that he released the 1996 film 'Ajay' without an ending because Sunny had gone to London and refused to come back on time.

321.title: Shashi Tharoor posts pic with Kunal Kamra after comedian's Gurugram show gets cancelled
321.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has shared a photo of him with Kunal Kamra after the comedian's show in Gurugram was cancelled amid VHP protests. Tharoor tweeted, "It's awful Kunal Kamra's show was cancelled, just like Vir Das and Munawar Faruqui earlier." He added, "What's our country coming to when a bunch of goons can intimidate organisers and censor free speech?"

322.title: Dog gifted by 18-yr-old's mother separated from him at US border; last pic goes viral
322.article_body: An 18-year-old Venezuelan migrant was separated from his dog at the US border, with their last picture going viral. The dog named Brandy had been a gift from Brayan Pinto's mother before her death to become his emotional support pet. Pinto handed over the dog to a photo journalist who agreed to take care of her in Mexico.

323.title: DDA launches housing scheme for 8,500 flats in Narela
323.article_body: The Delhi Development Authority (DDA) has launched its online housing scheme for 8,500 flats in Narela. The flats will be sold on a first come first serve basis to Economically Weaker Section (EWS) and Lower Income Group (LIG) households. The booking amount for EWS category flats is fixed at ₹10,000 and for LIG flats the booking amount is ₹15,000.

324.title: Protests in TN over tribal kids not being given eggs at school
324.article_body: Protests have erupted in a tribal settlement in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri after the children of the Irula community were not provided eggs during midday meals at their school. The school's headmaster said that he had reminded the noon meal organiser to supply eggs but she had not agreed. Eggs are not being supplied due to rains, officials claimed.

325.title: Ukrainian Prez urges West for more arms as troops recapture territory
325.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has called upon the West to speed up deliveries of weapons as troops plan to consolidate control over northeastern territory. Ukrainian troops have recaptured dozens of towns since Moscow abandoned its main bastion near Kharkiv. US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Ukraine has "benefitted from significant support from the US and other countries".

326.title: Ghaziabad doctor gets beheading threat for supporting Hindu groups, probe on
326.article_body: A Ghaziabad doctor allegedly received threatening calls, warning him not to support Hindu outfits or else, he will be beheaded. Dr Arvind Vats alleged that he received calls from a United States number, Circle Officer Alok Dubey said. The caller reportedly told Vats that neither PM Narendra Modi nor Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath would be able to protect him.

327.title: Salman Khan meets Jain monk as the latter accomplishes 180-day fast
327.article_body: Actor Salman Khan recently met Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur as the latter completed his 180 days of fasting. Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur is the only Jain monk to complete the 180-day fast for the sixth time. During their interaction, Salman went on to learn about Jainism and spoke about celebrities who have met the Acharya to seek his blessings.

328.title: Jindal University student found dead outside campus, family allege ragging
328.article_body: A 19-year-old second-year student of OP Jindal Global University was found dead outside the campus on an under-construction road in Haryana's Sonepat, police said. "The student had gone to visit his sister in Delhi...on Sunday his body was found outside the campus," police added. "The family has filed a complaint alleging some students had been ragging the victim," police stated.

329.title: OTT is brave new world for actresses: Somy Ali
329.article_body: Actress-activist Somy Ali called OTT platforms "a brave new world for female actors". She said there used to be a "genuine bias towards women" after they crossed the age of 35. However, she stated she has seen it "changing and disappearing", which she called a "sign of progress". Somy said in the 90s, the leading ladies were only props.

330.title: He is already married: Richa corrects journo who mixed Ali Fazal with Zafar
330.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha corrected a journalist's tweet who had mistakenly tagged Pakistani actor-singer Ali Zafar instead of actor Ali Fazal in a now-deleted tweet about Richa and Ali's wedding. Richa wrote, "Ali Zafar is a Pakistani singer/actor, who is already married." Their wedding festivities will reportedly begin on September 30 in Delhi and conclude on October 7 in Mumbai.

331.title: Kangana shares first look of Vishak Nair as Sanjay Gandhi in 'Emergency'
331.article_body: Actress-filmmaker Kangana Ranaut has shared the first look of actor Vishak Nair as Sanjay Gandhi from her upcoming directorial 'Emergency'. She wrote alongside the poster, "Presenting the powerhouse of talent...Sanjay was the soul of Indira...the man she loved and lost." Kangana will portray former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi in the film, which also features Anupam Kher and Shreyas Talpade.

332.title: Not intensely looking at it right now: Arjun on becoming producer
332.article_body: Arjun Kapoor said he wants to produce films and have a 360-degree perspective on filmmaking. While he said his switch from being an actor to a producer "could happen anytime", it's not something he's "intensely looking at right now". He said he is grateful for the opportunities that he's getting and hopes to deliver something fantastic in the upcoming films.

333.title: Why would public take permission from thieves: BJP leader on Nabanna march
333.article_body: When asked about BJP not getting permission from the police to hold Nabanna (State Secretariat) rally, West Bengal BJP president Sukanta Majumdar said, "Why would public take permission from thieves to hold demonstrations?" "Police [is] behaving like TMC cadres...We did Nabanna march last time when Section 144 was imposed, we'll do it again...It's our fight to save Bengal," he added.

334.title: Pune man chases girls playing in garden, shows them obscene videos
334.article_body: Pune City Police have booked a 53-year-old man who allegedly chased minor girls who were playing in a garden and showed them obscene videos on his mobile phone in Khadki. Another man who was in the garden had apparently tried to catch the accused, however, he managed to escape. One of the girls' fathers had filed an FIR on Sunday.

335.title: Siraj picks 4 wickets on Day 1 of his county debut for Warwickshire
335.article_body: India's Mohammed Siraj picked four wickets for Warwickshire on Day 1 of his County Championship debut match against Somerset. Siraj first dismissed opener Imam-ul-Haq in the 10th over and George Bartlett and James Rew on back-to-back deliveries in the 22nd to help reduce Somerset to 46/5. The 28-year-old then sent back Josh Davey, picking his fourth wicket of the day.

336.title: Mysterious 'moving train' of lights spotted in sky in Uttar Pradesh; pics viral
336.article_body: People in Lucknow, Kanpur and several other Uttar Pradesh cities spotted a mysterious string of lights in the night sky on Monday. Sharing pictures and videos on social media, people said that the dotted trail of lights was "moving like a train". While many speculated that they could be UFOs, the lights are most likely to be recently launched satellites.

337.title: CBI conducts pan-India raids over J&K Police SI recruitment scam
337.article_body: The CBI is conducting raids at 33 locations across the country in connection with the irregularities in the Jammu and Kashmir Police Sub-Inspector (JKPSI) recruitment exam. The locations where raids are underway include Jammu, Srinagar, Karnal, Mahendragarh, Rewari, Delhi, Ghaziabad and Bengaluru, according to an official. The paper of the exam, which was conducted in March, was allegedly leaked.

338.title: Getting sense of accomplishment by just being here: Radhika on TIFF
338.article_body: Radhika Madan said she got a "sense of accomplishment by just being" at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). The actress attended premiere of her film 'Kacchey Limbu', which received standing ovation at TIFF. Radhika said it was "overwhelming" to be part of the Shubham Yogi's directorial debut. She said her "childhood memories helped" to channelise emotions for her performance.

339.title: It's 'Congress Jodo Yatra' not 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Goa CM Pramod Sawant
339.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant criticised the Congress over its "Bharat Jodo Yatra" and called it "Congress Jodo Yatra". He also accused the party of splitting the nation. Sawant said, "Congress created Pakistan by splitting India before Independence. They are targeting BJP and RSS by burning RSS uniform. BJP and RSS have always talked about 'Bharat Jodna'."

340.title: Mumbai Police uses 'Brahmastra' movie reference in road safety tweet
340.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police shared 'Brahmastra' movie reference in a tweet to spread awareness about road safety. Referring to the movie characters, the police wrote, "Junoon and Raftar can put your 'Universe' at risk." "Even if you have Vanar Astra, don't jump the signal and even if you have Nandi Astra, don't use the strength on accelerator," it added.

341.title: Pakistan court extends ex-PM Imran Khan's bail in terrorism case
341.article_body: An anti-terrorism court in Islamabad on Monday extended the bail granted to Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan in an anti-terrorism case till September 20. Khan was booked under the Anti-Terrorism Act for allegedly threatening an additional sessions judge and police officials at a rally in Islamabad. Earlier, Khan warned he would become "more dangerous" if he's sent to jail.

342.title: 3-year-old nursery student raped by driver inside school bus in MP
342.article_body: A three-year-old nursery student was raped allegedly by her school bus driver inside the vehicle in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said on Tuesday. Police arrested the bus driver and a woman attendant who, according to the child's parents, was present inside the vehicle when the incident took place last Thursday. The child was returning home when the incident took place.

343.title: Pet kangaroo kills owner, tries to stop medics from accessing his body in Australia
343.article_body: A pet kangaroo killed its 77-year-old owner in Australia's Redmond, the country's first fatal kangaroo attack in more than 85 years. Emergency services were called to the scene, but the kangaroo prevented paramedics from accessing the man's body, as it became violent. Police said they had to kill the animal, as it "was posing an ongoing threat to emergency responders".

344.title: Drew parallel from my relationship with daughter for 'Jersey': Shahid
344.article_body: Shahid Kapoor said for 'Jersey', which also focused on a father-son relationship, he took references from his relationship with daughter Misha. "It was more with my daughter Misha at that point in time, Zain was way younger. So, the parallel I had here was with my daughter," he said. 'Jersey' was remake of the Telugu film with the same name.

345.title: Germany seeks talks with Switzerland on nuclear waste site controversy
345.article_body: Germany is seeking to hold talks with Switzerland over the proposal of sending nuclear waste to a repository near German border. The German Environment Ministry warned that the nuclear repository site would "heavily burden communities on the German side". Swiss authorities have indicated that they are open to making payments, although compensation for affected regions is yet to be discussed.

346.title: Sikh man with kirpan stopped from entering Delhi Metro, NCM seeks report
346.article_body: National Commission for Minorities (NCM) sought a report from the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) and Delhi Chief Secretary after a Sikh man, with kirpan, alleged he was stopped from entering the metro. The incident took place at Dwarka Sector 21 station on September 8. The man claimed he was stopped by security personnel and asked to remove the kirpan.

347.title: US TV host says India hasn't built 'beautiful' structures like Britishers, Tharoor replies
347.article_body: Fox News host Tucker Carlson said that India has not built a single structure "as beautiful as the Bombay train station the British colonialists built". Shashi Tharoor tweeted, "I think Twitter ought to have an option for something to press when you can't respond without losing your cool." Tharoor added he will content himself with angry emojis for now.

348.title: All illegal buildings in B'luru to be demolished like Noida twin towers: K'taka minister
348.article_body: Following the Bengaluru flooding, Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said that by the next monsoon, all illegal buildings will be demolished on the line of the Noida twin towers.
