"All apartments will be led off, as you saw in Noida. Action to be [taken] against officials...builders," he added. "The discussion regarding Bengaluru floods happened in the Assembly," Ashoka stated.

349.title: India just have to find clarity over no. 5 spot: Uthappa on squad for T20 WC
349.article_body: Indian veteran batter Robin Uthappa has said Team India's top-four and the lower-middle order for the T20 World Cup looks "extremely formidable". He added, "India just have to find clarity over that number five spot...That would be between Rishabh Pant and Deepak Hooda." The BCCI on Monday announced India's 15-member squad for the T20 World Cup.

350.title: Modi govt out to loot farmers, grab their land: Telangana CM KCR
350.article_body: While criticising the central government's power reforms, Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao said the BJP-led government and its local leaders were misleading people by saying that those were good reforms. "In reality, the Narendra Modi government just wants to loot farmers, grab their land and give [it] to private entrepreneurs," KCR said in the Assembly on Monday.

351.title: E-buses to run under free shuttle service from Delhi Secretariat
351.article_body: Delhi government plans to deploy e-buses to launch a free shuttle service from Delhi Secretariat to nearby metro stations and bus stops. The city's General Administration Department will be in charge of paying for the free bus service, a senior government official said. "Last week, GAD wrote to the transport department requesting for e-buses to run shuttle service," he added.

352.title: 1,561 youths joined militancy, 7,935 surrendered since 2016: Assam CM
352.article_body: As many as 1,561 youths have joined militant groups in Assam since 2016, said CM Himanta Biswa Sarma in a written reply in the state Assembly. "During the period 7,935 cadres of 23 different militant outfits surrendered and joined the mainstream," he added. A total of 84 persons have been arrested for Jihadi activities, he said.

353.title: Provocative song played in front of mosque in K'taka; case filed
353.article_body: The police have registered a suo moto case against organisers and a DJ owner after a provocative song was allegedly played in front of a mosque during a Ganesh Visarjan procession in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. This comes after a video of the incident surfaced online. The incident occurred on September 10 when the procession apparently stopped in front of the mosque.

354.title: 15,000 'overworked' nurses in US' Minnesota go on a 3-day strike
354.article_body: Some 15,000 nurses in the US state of Minnesota have gone on strike to protest against understaffing at hospitals. The Minnesota Nurses Association said health workers have been exhausted due to understaffing. The union said the three-day strike is one of the largest in the US history. Senator Bernie Sanders tweeted, "Nurses are the backbone of our health care system."

355.title: Viral video shows 3 kids travelling in open car boot in Telangana; police responds
355.article_body: A video showing three kids sitting in the boot of a moving car in Telangana went viral online. A Twitter user, who shared the video, sought action, saying, "How irresponsible parents they are?" Responding to the tweet, Cyberabad Traffic Police said, "Sir, your information has been verified and E-Challan has been generated. Thanks for joining hands...in improving road safety."

356.title: Mukul Rohatgi to return as Attorney General on October 1: Reports
356.article_body: Veteran lawyer Mukul Rohatgi is most likely to become the Attorney General for India again. According to reports, Rohatgi has agreed to succeed the current A-G KK Venugopal and is likely to begin his second tenure on October 1. Earlier, he had held the Attorney General post from June 2014 to June 2017.

357.title: Funeral directors' ad on hearse carrying Queen's body to Edinburgh removed mid-way
357.article_body: The branding of a funeral directors' company on Queen Elizabeth II's hearse was removed mid-way as it drove through Scotland. The sticker of the company, William Purves, was emblazoned on the vehicle as it departed Balmoral Castle on Sunday for a six-hour journey south to Holyroodhouse in Edinburgh. The company's website crashed after the advertisement was seen on the hearse.

358.title: BJP plunged J&K into unprecedented political uncertainty: Congress leader
358.article_body: The Congress on Monday alleged that BJP has pushed J&K into unprecedented political uncertainty by failing to maintain law and order in the Union Territory. "BJP...[has] been on a rampage of dispossessing and disempowering common people of Jammu and Kashmir. We've been used as political cannon fodders by BJP all across the country," J&K Congress chief Vikar Rasool Wani said.

359.title: KCR forming national party for his son: BJP MP K Laxman
359.article_body: After Telangana CM KCR announced that he will form a national political party, BJP MP K Laxman accused the CM of floating the national party for his son. "This party will be for his son to take over in Telangana...We have no problem with KCR forming a party at the national level or expanding his family party," said Laxman.

360.title: Road caves in due to sewerage pipe leak in Punjab's Ludhiana
360.article_body: A portion of a road has caved in near a level crossing in Punjab's Ludhiana with preliminary investigations revealing that the incident occurred due to leakage from the sewerage pipe of a nearby restaurant. A zonal commissioner said that the maintenance work will disrupt traffic as the area around the leakage needs to be dug up to check for damage.

361.title: BJP won't join freebie battle in Himachal Pradesh: CM Jairam Thakur
361.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said BJP will not join the freebie battle in the poll-bound state. Referring to the pre-poll freebies matter, Thakur added, "The people of Himachal are wise enough to sift through such hollow promises. They are not fools." Furthermore, he said that "the Congress is leaderless" in the absence of ex-CM late Virbhadra Singh.

362.title: 13-year-old raped by man she met online in Vadodara, accused held
362.article_body: A 13-year-old girl has been allegedly raped by a man she befriended on a social media site who lured her into accompanying him to a birthday party in Gujarat's Vadodara. The accused took her to his residence and threatened to kill her if she avoided his advances. The accused has been arrested following an FIR by the victim's father.

363.title: Nifty crosses 18,000 for 1st time since April, Sensex above 60,000
363.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Tuesday backed by gains across global markets. The Nifty opened 99.50 points up at 18,035.80, crossing the 18,000 mark for the first time since April 5. The Sensex also opened 329.73 points higher at 60,444.86 points. Stocks of Reliance Industries, Bajaj Finance, Titan Company and Infosys were among the major BSE gainers.

364.title: Rupee rises to 79.29 against US dollar, biggest jump in 3 weeks
364.article_body: The rupee registered its biggest jump in three weeks on Tuesday by gaining 23 paise to 79.29 against the US dollar from Monday's close of 79.52. The strengthening of the rupee was supported by a fall in global crude oil prices and also the American currency. The dollar index was last down by 0.2% at 107.9.

365.title: 'Only one will be left if I fight' says Ashok Chandna to Pilot after shoe thrown at him
365.article_body: After supporters of Rajasthan's former Deputy Chief Minister Sachin Pilot allegedly hurled shoes at meeting attended by BJP and Congress leaders, state Sports Minister Ashok Chandna named him in a tweet. "If Sachin Pilot becomes...Chief Minister by throwing...shoe at me...he should be made [CM] soon...I don't feel like fighting...The day I come to fight...only one will be left," he tweeted.

366.title: Priyanka Chopra shares glimpse of her walk-in closet in LA home
366.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram Stories to share a mirror selfie showing her walk-in closet in her Los Angeles residence with husband Nick Jonas. Brown and black boots can be seen on racks on one side of the walls. White shoes are mounted on shelves on the opposite side. Trolley bags can be seen lined up near the door.

367.title: Kareena Kapoor, Neetu Kapoor shoot together for first time; share pics
367.article_body: Actresses Kareena Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor will be sharing screen space for the first time. The two took to Instagram Stories to share pictures from the shoot of the unknown project. Kareena shared a selfie, writing, "When you shoot with family..." Neetu reposted the story, writing, "Loveee her." Neetu's late husband Rishi Kapoor and Kareena's father Randhir Kapoor are brothers.

368.title: Nation still bleeding, punish retired policeman who failed to act during 1984 riots: Delhi HC
368.article_body: Delhi High Court has granted liberty to Disciplinary Authority to issue "appropriate order of punishment" to a 79-year-old retired police officer who allegedly failed to deploy adequate force and make preventive detentions during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. "He may be 100 (years old). Kindly see the misconduct. Innocent people lost their lives. The nation is still bleeding," the court said.

369.title: 2 bike-borne men shoot at woman sitting outside house in Delhi
369.article_body: A 55-year-old woman was injured after two bike-borne men allegedly shot at her in Delhi's Bhalswa Dairy area, police said on Tuesday. The woman, who is from Rajasthan, had come to meet her daughter in Prakash Vihar and was sitting outside the house with the daughter and her granddaughter when the incident occurred, DCP (Outer North) Devesh Kumar Mahla said.

370.title: FIR against 3 as 8 killed in fire at e-bike showroom at Secunderabad
370.article_body: An FIR has been filed against three persons after eight persons died following a massive fire that engulfed an electric bike showroom and a lodge above it at Secunderabad, police said. A case has been registered against the owner of the building and the showroom owner. The victims were all staying in the lodge located above the showroom, police added.

371.title: Ray of sun shines down on Queen's coffin; pic goes viral
371.article_body: A picture showing a ray of sun shining down on the Queen's coffin during a procession to transport her body to St Giles' Cathedral in Edinburgh has gone viral. The picture captured by Georgie Gillard was shared on Instagram by Story Picture Agency. Earlier, a double rainbow appeared over the Buckingham Palace after the demise of the Queen.

372.title: I have a bone edema issue, I couldn't run or walk: World no. 5 Zverev on injury
372.article_body: World number five Alexander Zverev, who hasn't played since June due to an ankle injury he suffered in his French Open semi-final against Rafa Nadal, has revealed that his comeback could be delayed by months due to a bone edema issue. "It causes me a lot of pain…it got to the point where I couldn't run or walk," he stated.

373.title: DVAC conducts searches at 26 places linked to ex-AIADMK minister SP Velumani
373.article_body: Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption is conducting searches at 26 places linked to former AIADMK minister SP Velumani in connection with allegations that he had abused his official position in awarding tenders injudiciously to his close associated companies. Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu Police detained seven AIADMK MLAs and several workers for protesting outside Velumani's Coimbatore residence.

374.title: Notice issued to textbook publisher over missing words in national anthem
374.article_body: UP Basic Education Department has issued a show-cause notice to a class 5 textbook publisher over national anthem being published with two words missing. Notices have also been issued to Basic Shiksha Adhikari (BSA) of Mathura and divisional education assistant director, Basic, Agra who were responsible for checking textbooks for any printing errors before they were distributed to students.

375.title: Police hooter should strike fear in criminals: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
375.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said a police hooter itself should strike fear in criminals and be enough to make them "tremble". "Criminals shouldn't be spared under any circumstances. From day one, we've taken pledge to eliminate criminals in UP and our government is doing it," CM Yogi added. He was reviewing the law and order situation in Baghpat.

376.title: We have retaken 6,000 sq km from Russia: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
376.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that since the beginning of the month, Ukrainian forces have retaken more than 6,000 square kilometers of Russian-held territory in the east and south. "The movement of our troops continues," Zelenskyy added. Russia had admitted losing key cities in the north-eastern Kharkiv region. Russia began its invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

377.title: Kerala govt plans to kill violent dogs, to seek SC permission
377.article_body: The Kerala government has decided to seek permission from the Supreme Court to kill rabid and violent dogs. The state is planning to conduct a month-long drive from September 20 to contain dog menace. "[The] situation is really serious…We have decided to…devise several plans to contain mounting dog bite cases," said Local Self Government Minister M B Rajesh.

378.title: Car catches fire on highway in Mumbai, Maha CM Shinde stops to help; video surfaces
378.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday stopped on Mumbai's Western Express Highway in the Vile Parle area to help the occupant of a car which caught fire. A video of the incident has surfaced online wherein Shinde can be seen speaking to the car driver. A fire official said that two fire engines were rushed and the fire was doused.

379.title: Men used to decide which actress they want to work with back then: Mandakini
379.article_body: Veteran actress Mandakini, who made her debut in 1985, has said that in those days, men used to decide which actress they want to work with. "That was a male-oriented period. During those days heroines were not very much in demand. They were just used only for 3-4 songs and very few romantic scenes," the actress added.

380.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
380.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) said that there will be scheduled power shutdowns in the city for the rest of the month as it will carry out maintenance and repair works in rain-affected areas. BESCOM shared a list of places that will face power outages today and tomorrow which includes areas like Ramanagara, HSR Layout, Jayanagar, etc.

381.title: Indian-origin girl dies on b'day after being left alone for hours in Qatar school bus
381.article_body: A four-year-old Indian-origin girl, Minsa Mariyam Jacob, was found dead inside her school bus on her birthday in Qatar. Minsa, a kindergarten student, was locked inside the bus for hours after the crew didn't notice that she was sleeping. "The vehicle was left behind and she got stuck inside it in high heat," her relative said.

382.title: People attacked me on social media when I criticised Rizwan: Akram
382.article_body: Discussing Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan's 55 (49) in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "(Rizwan)...[did] the same thing against Hong Kong." "I criticised him...People attacked me on social media," added Akram. "If you want my opinion, I will give you the...straightforward opinion. I'm not the guy who'll lie about what I see," he stated.

383.title: Shah removed Article 370 like teacher erases dirty letters: Union Minister
383.article_body: Union Minister Parshottam Rupala on Monday said that Home Minister Amit Shah removed Article 370 just like a "good teacher erases dirty letters from the blackboard". Rupala was speaking at World Dairy Summit 2022 at Greater Noida, which was also attended by Shah and UP CM Yogi Adityanath. Rupala praised Shah for his "tremendous amount of political will power".

384.title: I would love to work with Kapil: Asgar on returning to ‘The Kapil...’
384.article_body: Discussing his reaction to a potential offer from comedian Kapil Sharma over rejoining 'The Kapil Sharma Show', comedian Ali Asgar said, "I'd love to work with him...[and] do something new." "There's no enmity," added Asgar. Asgar had quit the show in 2017, stating he "can't cheat" as an artiste. Kapil had earlier stated that he'd "block" Asgar following his exit.

385.title: I think my opportunity will definitely come: Rahul Tripathi
385.article_body: Batter Rahul Tripathi, who is yet to make his India debut despite being part of squads for Ireland T20Is and Zimbabwe ODIs, has said that he's happy that he has now "at least come into the scheme of things". "I think my opportunity will definitely come, and my job is to keep performing in whatever opportunities I get," he added.

386.title: Pune to face water cuts from 10 pm on Sept 14 to 10 pm on Sept 15
386.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has announced that parts of the city will face water cuts from 10 pm on September 14 to 10 pm on September 15 due to the planned installation of flow meters. Water supply will resume on September 16 in the morning with low pressure, it added. Places like Fatimanagar and Pune Cantonment Board area will be affected.

387.title: Cong harboured hatred for us, wants to connect people through hatred: RSS
387.article_body: RSS Joint General Secretary Dr Manmohan Vaidya on Monday said that the Congress wants to connect people through hatred. "Can you unite India through hatred? They have harboured hatred and contempt for us for a long time. Their earlier generations too tried to stop the RSS but we kept growing as we were supported by the people," Vaidya added.

388.title: Always resorting to slander: Banerjee to Opposition leaders criticising Bengal
388.article_body: Days after Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized cash worth crores from a Kolkata-based businessman, CM Mamata Banerjee criticised some political parties for trying to only create a negative image of the state. "They are always resorting to slander. Had they highlighted the positive works of the state government, both Bengal and its people would have benefited," she said.

389.title: 32-year-old co-pilot found dead at home in Delhi, probe underway
389.article_body: Police have started investigation after a 32-year-old co-pilot with a private airline was found dead at his residence in Delhi’s Palam. The deceased, who was reportedly found dead on Saturday, was married and hailed from Kerala, officials said. Police suspected it to be a suicide, adding that the deceased might have taken the step as he failed in an exam.

390.title: 2 arrested for planting explosive near basketball ground in Imphal
390.article_body: Two people have been arrested for planting an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) near a basketball ground at Singjamei Chingamakha in Manipur's Imphal, said police. One of the two suspects, Kshetrimayum Bhogendro Singh, who was caught first, revealed he is an active member of insurgent group UNLF, according to police. His disclosure led to the arrest of the other suspect.

391.title: We shot in -22°C, I had nosebleeds, bruises, allergies: Mrunal on 'Sita Ramam'
391.article_body: While talking about her movie 'Sita Ramam', actress Mrunal Thakur said that shooting for it was challenging. "There are so many layers in the character. And you would not believe it, the weather over there was so challenging. We've shot in like minus 22 degrees, in places where I've had like nosebleeds, bruises and allergies," she added.

392.title: Fresh clashes erupt between Azerbaijan, Armenia
392.article_body: Fresh clashes between Armenian and Azerbaijan forces were reported on Monday, which has left an unknown number of troops dead. The fighting reportedly took place in the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region, and both the countries have blamed each other for the initial provocations. The two sides had fought a six-week-long war over Nagorno-Karabakh in 2020, which ended with a Russian-brokered deal.

393.title: Saba Azad reveals why she changed name from Saba Grewal, says 'Azad was nani’s pen name'
393.article_body: Singer-actress Saba Azad has revealed why she changed her name from Saba Grewal, stating, "My father is of Sikh origin and my mother of Muslim, but neither practiced religion." Adding that Azad was her nani's (grandmother) pen name, she said, "I liked the...meaning...The want for freedom is the most human instinct. So I adopted it as my stage name."

394.title: Goldman Sachs preparing for layoffs across all departments in Sept: Report
394.article_body: Goldman Sachs is preparing to make its first round of layoffs since the outbreak of the pandemic, as per a report. It is expected to cut jobs across all departments as soon as next week. The bank usually initiates a round of layoffs, called Strategic Resource Assessment, annually, on the basis of employee performance and can terminate 1-5% of workers.

395.title: Nintendo shares surge 5% after record launch sales of 'Splatoon 3'
395.article_body: Shares of Nintendo surged 5% on Tuesday after the gaming company reported domestic launch sales of over 3.45 million units for its shooter "Splatoon 3" on the Switch console. "Splatoon 3", which was launched on September 9, exceeded the sales of "Animal Crossing: New Horizons" and "Super Smash Bros. Ultimate", which respectively sold 39.4 million and 28.8 million units globally.

396.title: HDFC Life Insurance shares surge 2.5% after reports of block deal
396.article_body: Shares of HDFC Life Insurance surged in Tuesday's opening trade after reports of a block deal in which around 43 million shares, or a 2% stake of the firm, changed hands. At 9:17 am, its stock was trading at ₹594 on the BSE, a jump of 2.5%. Edinburgh-based Abrdn is reportedly expected to offload 43 million shares in the company.

397.title: What is inside the 2022 Emmy Awards' gift bag?
397.article_body: Celebrities will receive a trip to Four Seasons Nevis in the West Indies. Other trip alternatives for Emmys 2022 attendees include three-night stay at the RiverView Ranch Retreat & Western Adventures in Montana and a three-night stay at the Museum Hotel in Cappadocia, Turkey. The gift bag also has skincare products, canned drinks, bag of caramels and everyday essentials.

398.title: Asif batted with 4 stitches, Shadab's ear was bleeding: Pak's Saqlain on Asia Cup final
398.article_body: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq has revealed that Asif Ali batted with four stitches in his hand and Shadab Khan batted despite his ear bleeding during the Asia Cup 2022 final. Asif was dismissed for a golden duck while Shadab got out for eight runs off six deliveries as Pakistan lost the final by 23 runs.

399.title: Surprised at omission of Shreyas & Shami: Azharuddin on India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
399.article_body: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin took to Twitter to share that he is surprised at the omission of batter Shreyas Iyer and fast bowler Mohammad Shami from India's main T20 World Cup 2022 squad. "Shreyas instead of Deepak Hooda and Shami in the place of Harshal Patel would be my choice," he added. Shreyas and Shami have been named as standbys.

400.title: Attacked by monkeys, 5-year-old boy falls to death from roof in UP
400.article_body: A five-year-old boy playing on the roof of his house fell to death after he was reportedly attacked by a group of monkeys in UP's Budaun district on Sunday. The victim, Nikhil, was rushed to a hospital but he did not survive. His family refused to send the body for autopsy, said a police official.

401.title: Infosys warns staff against moonlighting, says 'No two-timing, no double lives': Report
401.article_body: Infosys has warned employees against dual employment or 'moonlighting', stating that any violation will lead to disciplinary action, including termination of employment, the Times of India reported. With the taglines 'No two-timing, no moonlighting' and 'No double lives', Infosys told employees they cannot take up other assignments during or outside business hours without seeking its consent.
